text: Bottle at 3 Fonteinen. Shared with the wife. Cheers! Pours a deep red, small pink head. Loads of sentiment. Aromas of cherry skins, deep horse blanket funk, light almond, light hay. Taste is loaded with cherry skins, jam, almond. Wet oak. Very soft mouth feel, very light acidity. Incredibly balanced and smooth. Could drink this all day!!

750 ml bottle (v2011) shared wt the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Thank you Dylan for bringing this! Dark red color with pinkish head. Yeasty aroma, funky, tart fruity, cherries -berries. Sweet and acidic fruity taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

How: Bottle, 2006 vintage.
Where: Tasting at Björn, 2017-03-04.
Appearance: Dark pink/red colour with a small pink head.
Aroma: Cherries, sour, fruit.
Body: Light to medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Cherries, fruit, sour.Earlier Rating: 10/17/2012 Total Score: 3.2Sample @ SBWF 12. Hazy red colour with a small white head. Lots of cherry in the aroma. Flavour is fruity, sour, cherry.

Bottle shared at 3 Fonteinen Lambik-o-droom. Pours cloudy dark pink with no head. Aroma of sour cherry, leather, wood, straw. Light sweetness, heavy sour. Light to medium body, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, sour, cherry.

750ml bottle at the brewery. Pours out deep red topped with a pink head. Nose is great rich tart sweet cherries barnyard barrel notes. Taste is more of the nice heavy hitting cherries sweet and funky tartness.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 Bottiglia da 75 cl presso 3 Fonteinen di Lot (lambik o?droom). Schiuma rosé volatile e poco persistente, colore rosso fragolino. Al naso stalla, calzini sporchi ma coadiuvati dallodore di ciliegie selvatiche che avvolge. Al gusto è unesplosione acida di frutta con un finale acido e astringente ma non acetico. Carbonatazione molto vivace, da stile. Direi perfetta nel suo stile in tutte le sfaccettature.
Bottle at Akkurat. Pours clear burgundy with a pink circumference head. Aroma is slight funky cheesy feet, cherries and a hint of cinnamon. Taste is cherry sweet, cinnamon, mild-high sour, oak.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Bottle at the brewery. Hazy ruby pour with a fine-grained pink head. Tons of sour cherries, cherry cores, raw almonds, minerals, barnyard funk, macerated cherries. Very dry, light and refreshing. Delicious.

bottle @ home
clear cherry peach, minimal pink head
cellar, black cherry liquor
light astringency, black cherries, sour ¨

From notes. Enjoyed at a tasting Kyle finally made it to at Mickeys on December 01. 750 mL bottle, 2005 vintage. The pour is a dirty reddish color with a thicker pink head and a couple spots of lace as it falls to a film. This is an interesting thing. There is a plastic VOC thing happening on the nose. There is a light rubber band thing going on that Im not crazy about. There is a good amount of cherry and a nice tartness, but its just not as crisp and clean as I was hoping it would be. The flavor is much of the same. The cherry is a little dry and the VOCs and rubber band are still prevalent. The mouth feel is thicker and syrupy with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and tart cough syrup thing happening that just doesnt do it for me. Maybe this needs to be a little fresher.

A delicious kriek from 2011. Round in the taste with medium-high sourness. Dark red liquid with an exceptionel white head. Average carbonation and full body with long lasting taste of cherries. Fantastic experiance.

Botella @In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst 04/12/16 Botella:2011
Color rojizo, sabor frutal, final agrio, fruta, cuerpo medio, rica.
Bottle @ Lambik o drom, Beersel. Light hazy deep red pour with a off white head. Tons of tart cherries, funky, light bitter, almonds and a subtle tartness. Delicious!

Sample from 2002 bottle at the Trailer. Rich, nutty, almond, marzipan, cherries subdued, not so tart. Soft cherry, subdued. Bit of coconut too. Low carb. Fucking great. Aroma has more cherry. Some tomato sauce!

Bottle @ Lambik O Droom. Pours juicy dark red with a big pink head. Aromas of sour cherries, light marzipan, vanilla, leathery, vinegar. Taste has sour cherries, subtle sweet almonds, vinegar, cherry pits, vinegar, citrussy, leathery and stable notes. Nice!

From bottle at 3F Lambik-O-Droom. Pours a lovely clear ruby red with a big, pink head. Aroma has intense sweet and sour cherries, light marzipan, funk, vanilla. Taste is suuuper nicely balanced with dry cheesy funky notes, light earthy, sour fruits, but still lovely drinkability. High carbonation and a light, crisp body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at lambik-O-droom. Cloudy red with white head. Aroma is very barnyard, funky and tart, also fruity cherries. Taste very nice ripe cherries, yeasty, clean, and crispy. Slightly dry and woody.

Pours a hazy purple red from the bomber with thin ring of bubbly pink head. Aroma of vinous grape, tart raspberry, complex funk notes, and a hint of acidity. Taste is sweet fruitiness, funk in the middle, and a dry finish. Really intensely funky and fruity, but nice balance and super drinkable, a bit pricey though, even in Brussels.

Bottle @ Lambic o droom. Pours muddy Deep reddish with a small pink head. Aroma of Deep cherry, barn, light Vanilla like notes, light cherry Stone, Deep funk, quite wooden. Taste is heavy cherries, loads of barn and funk, very jammy. Quite dry wooden. Very balanced.

Bottle at 3f in Lot. Great floral cherries in the nose. The beer starts extremely fruity. Lots of fresh red sour cherries. Intense with a fantastic smooth sourness. Fresh smooth cherries in the aftertaste, intense smooth, fantastic!
UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Pours a rusty red, cloudy murky rusty red with a white. Huge cherry notes and berry notes, barnyard and  vinegar

Unlabelled 750ml bottle. Lambik-O-droom. Ruby red. Soft haze. Pale pink head, that dissipates. Nose has old cherries. Cherry stone. Vanilla tinged oak. Some sour cherry skin. Taste is light, fruity sour. Some sweetness on the lips. Light, clean body. Very cleansing and a little tannic. Light, cherry sour finish. Lovely.
Bottle at 3F Open Beer Days in LambiekODroom. Full cherryflavour, light metallic taste, sour, some lemons. Lovely.
Bottle from 3F Open Beer Days. Poured hazy red with white head. Aroma sour killer crushed cherry. Light carb med bod. Taste very cherry skin light tart. Well rounded

A 750ml bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. There were two conflicting bottling dates. The original label has a bottled on date of 28th April 2010 whereas Moeder Lambic added a 2015 bottling label. Whatever research I could muster up shows that there does appear to be a 2015 bottling on 30th January 2015 out there (first since 2011). Poured into a 3 Fonteinen gueuze glass. It poured a cloudy dark ruby red colour with a big three finger light pink head that dissipated fairly quickly, leaving very sparse lacing. Aromas of very nice fruity cherry and strawberry with a hint of vanilla. Tastes sour, tart, cherry and strawberry with some very light funk. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall very nice and refreshing with great aromas. Unfortunately I have not tried the regular Oude Kriek though, so I cannot compare to that yet.

750 mL bottle. 2008 bottle. Originally reviewed 3/2/2013.

Red body. Not much of a head, but there wasnt much of a pop when the cork came out.

Still has a strong cherry nose. Less of the Drie Fonteinen signature funk. More of a lemony acidity. Hefty oak to it.

Lemon sourness up front. Cherry flavor isnt sweet. More dry and wine like. Finishes very dry and oaky.

Mild sourness. Much more dry than sour. Low carbonation, but that could be age. Mustiness does indicate its age though.

Lacking the Drie Fonteinen complexity, but that cherry flavor is very nice. Thats the point I guess.

Merci à Rémi pour le partage de ce vintage 2010. Une autre grande kriek toutefois bien différente de la Lou Pepe de Cantillon qui a précédé celle-ci. Liquide très clair sans pour autant être cristallin. Aucune mousse ou presque ne survit lorsque le liquide est versé dans mon verre. Ce lambic est probablement le lambic fruité le plus clean - pour emprunter lexpression qui décrit le mieux cette bière, quil ma été donné de déguster. Le fruit ayant tombé avec le temps, il demeure dans cette boisson une cerise délicate qui se conjugue parfaitement à une touche boisée et claire. Le funk présent est délicat, laissant place à des saveurs bien précises de fruit dété. Rien ne vient brouiller les cartes, pas même une leffervescence pour nous distraire. Un lambic très cartésien.
Bottle - Woody and cedar like cherry. Cloudy reddish with a white head. Wild cherry, tobacco and leather with a long cherry finish. Superb.
Sampled at rbsg. Turbid deep red. Funkiness. Cherry and grape skins. Earthy. Tart cherries. Big deep malts. Dry funk. Intetesting. Not my style, tho.
750ml bottle @rbsg-pbgh GT thanks Nate for the beer and the basket pour. disappearing offwhite ring-amber. A-acetic/tart cherries. T-follows, nice.

750ml bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours bright red with a finger of pink head. Beautiful nose of layered barnyard, toasty oak spice, dusty funk and juicy earthy cherry. Palate is similar with nice sweetness of earthy tart cherry spice, complex farmy funk, nice level of tartness and a finish of drying oak. Great!

2010 bottle. Thanks angst! Aroma is huge funky cotton and damp basement, leather, horse blanket, cherry skins, and vinegar. Tastes super sour but still smooth. Vinegar, cherries and funk. Delicious stuff.

2011 bottle. 
Aroma is really nice with lots of funkiness and balanced, dry sour cherry notes. Some light oak notes with moderate herbal character. Nice, earthy funk. 
Pours a somewhat hazy, purple red with with a medium sized, slightly pink, white head that recedes to the edges where it lingers. Light lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a moderate acidity. Moderate tart cherry notes. Lots of herbal funk with some nice earthy notes as well. Light oak notes. Great balance of funk and cherry. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer. The cherry has faded nicely, but is still vibrant and the funk has really come through and worked greatly.

2004, gusher
A: Deep red going to brown, nice white head N: Cherry, oak, cheese, wet wood, oak T: Wet wood, cherry, funky, cheese, forest, almond O: Very nice! Extremly complex flavours! Less cherry than expected, but this aged so well!!

Bottled 10/17/2008. Pours a hazy Amber with thin bubbly head. Aromas of cherry jolly rancher, biscuits, fruit basket. Flavors are similar plus plum, apple cider vinegar (in a good way), and  sweet oak. Finish is fruity, tart cherry, oaky, tannic, and long. This is by far one of the great beer tasting experiences in my life and totally worth a perfect beer score. Absolutely no faults or imperfections in this brew. Happy New Year!!!
Het Klooster, Delft. Grote fles. Diep rood. Dik, zure kersen. Houtlijmig, rubber. Hooiig. Yoghurt. Flink zuur.

Bottle at Klooster. Dark red with beautiful small light pink head. Lots of cherries, red berries, yoghurt, green apple, lime, cola flavoured candy, sourdough, touch of malts. Taste is fruity sour, which deepens into a light acidic sourness, then a light sweet aftertaste. Medium mouth, slick texture with perfect carbonation. Very good stuff.

(750ml 2010 bottle @ Grote Dorst, Eizeringen, Nov 15 2015, split w/ phyllomedusa) Pours a very lightly hazed light ruby red with a tiny short lived off white head without lace. Aroma of lots of bright, lean sour cherry flesh, lemon zest, light bodied red wine, maybe red currant?, fairly light woodiness, funk is fairly light with dry barnyard, hay and a little fresh cheese. Flavour is tart and medium-high acidic with sour cherry flesh, light red wine, a touch of lemon lacto and acetic acid. Some real leafy/herbal notes as well. Finish is still quite bright and tart but dries down a fair bit with leathery oak and some earthy, lightly funky yeast notes. More herbal/grassy notes on the finish too, a bit spicy and lightly tannic. Medium bodied with quite low carbonation. This is fairly bright, tart and elegant, reminding me a lot of a Beaujolais remade as lambic. Certainly on the more acidic side, and not jammy, but very pleasant to sip nonetheless. Nice kriek!
2007 versie. Oranje roze ondoorzichtig bier zonder kraag. Ruikt framboos, zuur, fruitig. Smaakt fruitig, framboos, tarted, goed zuur.

Muddy red color with little foam. The smell is very cheery intense. The taste has an awesome combination of fruitiness and sourness without the aggressive touch. Sour staying aftertaste. Awesome beer.
Bottle at Zwanze Day Zurich. Oh boy, what a kriek. Lots of cherry, just the roght balance of tart, sour, and crispy. Very smooth and easy to drink, too.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 At Zwanze Day 2015 at Erzbierschof, shared with anstei and others. Dark purple color with hardly any head. Aroma is complex, not too aggressive, fruity, sour cherries, nice bitter almonds aroma. Taste is dark and complex, sour cherries, stone/almonds, wood. Fantastic complexity. Cream foamy carbonation. Dry sour finish. Worth the wait, and probably the best beer I?ve ever had. 10-4-10-5-20

2015 bottle, poured by Armand in February 2017. Just the most beautiful and deep Kriek I?ve ever had, without any sweetness, without being too sour or unbalanced.

2005 bottle shared at Grote Dorst. Yes, this is one of *the* best beers in the world. Much woodier, horseblanket-ier than the fresh one, but with incredible depth and complexity without turning too sour.

750ml bottle (2010) in a tulip. Pours deep pink with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of sourness, strong cherries, a good amount of oak, some light funk, light malts, and some more fruitiness. Flavor the same with a great blend of the strong cherries and sourness and oak and funk. Average texture. A great beer.
Bottle 11 - pours dark deep red. Lots of sour cherries smells plus lemon zest, grassy. Cherries are slightly faded but nice lemon tartness.
Great strong aroma. Veryvsour, hoeever aftertaste a bit mildrr. Rich palete. To sour, however a very good beer
Bottle if 2010. Red hazy with small pink head. Excellent cherry aroma. Sour, for the first feeling too sour, cherry taste, but an excellent long lasting cherry aftertaste.
Bottle to glass. Pours a clear ruby red color with a pinkish head. Aroma is dry, big sour cherry. Same in the flavor. huge sour that lingers into the finish. Excellent.

(Bottle) Clear red colour with frothy, pinkish white head. Fruity, sourish nose with red fruit, cherries, almonds, citrus, aromas of barnyard and stable. Fruity, tart taste with notes of sour cherries, red fruit, almonds, pink grapefruit, sour grapes, cellar, a touch of rhubarb and a fresh, dry tart finish with a slight tannin sourness. Medium body, bone dry. Very fresh and tasty with a lovely sourness. The kriek against which all others are measured. Lovely stuff!

Bottle at Chriso easter tasting. Many thanks to Bruce for this one. Deep purple pink / orange coloured pour with a fine head. Aroma is tart raspberry sharp fruity, Musty. Flavour is composed of sharp raspeberry, cherry, sharp, Palate is crisp sharp, tart fruit, uber dry, crisp, tart fruit. I like this.
Dark red garnet hazy pour, bread day vyeast show through big cherry aroma and flavor. Lively carbonation brings out all the mentioned above. Great cherry crisp tart finish.

Bottle, shared at Rose Red. Pours a clear dark pinkish beer with a medium sized, light pink head. Aroma of cherries, Brett, red fruits and a typical 3 Fonteinen touch. Flavor is very tarty, a lot of fruits, bit of wood and it has a very dry mouthfeel and finish. Nice stuff.
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

shared 2010 bottle with a friend at moeder lambic. poured a hazy dark red colour with a nice pink-ish head. sour cherries, tart, citrus, horse blanket, red wine notice, real tart bomb! boy this was lovely! i wanted to try this one for a long time! and it was even better as i was expecting! amazing!

2005 vintage at Grote Dorst. Red Brown with a ring of foam. Cherry and raspberry, stinky feet, cheese and some mint. Taste is heavy lactic notes, cherry, oak and some vinegar unfortunately. Full bodied and light carbonation. Good beer that didnt age so well, will rerate a fresher bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 750ml bottle served in a Mort Subite chalice.
Bottle date 25/04/2011
A: First of all, beautiful bottle art. Corked 750ml bottle. Pours a dark rose color forming a medium but very fizzy and noisy big bubbled head leaving practically no lacings in the glass
S: Very fruity. Strong notes of cherry juice and apple vinegar. Funky and sour. A bit metallic. Light notes of sweet malts. A bit earthy. Leather. Earthy yeasts
T: Slight sweet upfront. Becoming suddenly quite dry and funky. Strong notes of apple vinegar, and cherry juice. Metallic. A bit earthy in the end
M: Very light and watery body. Medium carbonation. Sour and fruity aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. State of art Lambic beer
[ BA Review @ 6/10/2014 ]

"similar in color to the "regular" kriek. a little more vibrant in the aroma and nose, and a touch more puckering and sweeter as well. nice balance. very nice treat. cant remember the exact price, but north of $30, this needed to be a top 10 all timer to revisit. it is not, but it is a very nice beer!"

bottle shared and enjoyed with friends, thanks! pours unclear bright red with a very nice almost white cap, reviving and leaving some nice lacing. 3f funk, spicy cherries, red grapes, zinfandel-ish, herbal tea leaves, raspberry leafy notes, light to medium acidity - citric and lactic - not quite pungent, smooth oak. average to light carbonation, light body, dry, assertively tart and spicy-peppery-grassy finish. excellent!

Pours a hazy red with a white rim on top that leaves some lacing. Nose is of cherries and light funk, pretty nice. Taste is dry and loaded with (really) tart cherries. This is just too acidic for me to enjoy in large quantities, quite a shame since everything is so good! Body was light to medium and carbonation medium. Overall a really good oude kriek, I just dont appreciate them as ultra lactic as everyone else. :(

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Older vintage (2004) if not mistaking. Pours hazy ruby red with a light purple hue, nice thin head. Left it aerate for about 10 minutes as initial sour punch is quite high. Once settled the aroma is but fantastic: the sweetest cherry and almond aromas intertwine lovely, some pinot noir touches and only a hint of madeira. Punchy tartness and sourness with quite some tannins but all ends very foresty fruity, quite an explosion actually
Smells like a sour. Low but fizzy carbonation. Tastes like a sour with a bit of cherry kick to it. Aftertaste is 15 seconds and the same. Very sour, but very easy to drink too.

Brite redfunk aroma with tons of cherries. Awesome nose kept on emulating. Flavor of extremely tart cherries, slight lemon and thick rich dry fruit end flavor. All flavors did so well together, very very slight carbonation, so easy and nice to drink A++++

I thought this was the only kriek he had out for the longest time, since I was always able to find it. Red pour. Small pinkish head that falls quick and leaves some minute traces of lacing. Sour aroma of cherries and funk. Taste is tart with some cherry flavors. Some funky notes, but softy and subdued. Could drink it daily if my stomach would allow.

C&C 750 mL bottle, bottle date of 5/4/2004, sent to me by Papsoe a few years ago. Thanks! Shared with some friends of mine, 6/16/14. Pours a hazy salmon color with a thin white head that sticks around a while. Aroma of pepper, funk, horseblanket, mold, wood, dry cherries. The taste is tart jammy cherries, pepper, funk, moldy books, lemon, olive, leather. Medium bodied, low carbonation, slight lingering spice. Has held up well over the last decade. Exceptional beer.

750ml 2011 vintage at Akkurat with Taylor, Kimberly, and Stefan. Pours dark ruby red, fresh cheer juice, hint of vinegar. Tast is cherries, some tanic chalk notes, subtle sourness that is well crafted with cherries, a slight sweetness that melds with the fruit notes, but still tastes perfectly dry for an oude Lambic. Really like it, but not that complex.
Bottleshare thanks to Homer. Pours a ruby red, no head. Smells of cherry and tart. Taste is sweet, sour, cherry. Cherry is mild, almost a tad watered down. Decently tasty.
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Aroma is funky, sweet tart, cherry, fairly dry, sweet. Deep red, fairly hazy, no head. Sour, tart cherry, cherry skins, quite dry but still crisp and semisweet.

Bottle. Nose is a nice fruitiness initially. Light tartness in the nose. Pour is a drastic red with almost no head. Taste is immediately tart and acidic. Very one dimensional and flat initially. Kind of opens up but seems still less than impressed

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Artisanal, entirely traditional oude kriek, to that extent that only the original Schaarbeekse cherries are used, like in the old days; this explains the price, but this is worth every penny. Firm, crackling, light pinkish head, deep cherry red colour. Very complex and extremely well-balanced aroma with massive fresh fruit, taste equally fruity, genuine, sour, complex, funky, sherryish, utterly refreshing and ending in a long, sourish dry, satisfying finish. Easily the best kriek I ever had the pleasure to taste, a true masterpiece.
Bottle 0.75l. Pours deep red with minimal head. Aroma is intense cherry, funky, oak. Taste is full of deep cherry flavour balanced by sourness and hints of oak. Perfect beer.

Sampled many times, finally rating. Pours a deep garnet color with minimal head. Deep rich aromas of cherry pie filling, baking spice, oak, citric acid, hints of cranberry. Dry, sour palate with thorough flavors of cherry preserve, cherry skin, and cherry pie filling. Additionally there is oak, lemon, and wet hay/funk notes. Very solid.

Deep red in color, beautiful appearing.... Aroma of dark cherries, tartness, oak... Flavor of funk, dark cherries, tartness, oak, deep fruit character... Lots of funk on finish, dark cherries... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Belle couleur rubis foncé, un peu trouble, peu de mousse. Nez très expressif, sur la cerise aigre, le fruit rouge, un côté métallique, un léger boisé un peu fumé. Bouche vive, "tendue" par une grosse acidité, sèche, assez légère, carbonatation assez basse, beaucoup de cerise, un léger côté aigre mais beaucoup de fraîcheur, boisé léger. Seule la finale pourrait être un peu plus longue et encore plus acide. Mais une Kriek de haut niveau.
Deep, deep cherry lambic with a strong tart nose and taste. The mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth, with an assured acidity.

Muuu! I i miei sensi muggiscono risvegliati dal potere acido di questa birra divina. Note intense di ciliegie che avvolgono il palato piroettano voluttuosamente su uno sfondo acido ammorbidito dallinvecchiamento, incredibilimente elegante e bilanciato. Chiudo gli occhi in estasi e continuo a muggire. Muuu!

Poured from bottle into sample glass (Kriek-off): Pours deep purple with a decent pink head. This reminds me a bit of grape juice with some cherries in it. A bit metallic, but certainly not poison like Ernesto states. A bit medicinal at the back end. Really not bad at all.
Pour is ruby red - nose is tart cherries, a touch herbal. Taste is mouth puckering cherries, herbs, yogurt, really tart without being overly acidic. Creamier mouthfeel than typical for the style.

Poured from 750 to glass. Pink hue with light pink fizzy head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is acetic, white pepper, cherry. Mouthfeel is good with light body and high carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a spicy astringentness in the following coupled with sour. CO2 sharpness throughout the finish. Overall this was an interesting brew. Not as cherry fruit as some Kreiks that Ive had...more of a cherry pit taste.
Blind sample, complete poison, pool cleaning chemicals and barf. Chris liked ot

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Opened this on Easter to celebrate. Pours a reddish pink color with plenty of nice carbonation. Tastes tart but not puckery, great cherry flavor with just enough of that signature 3 Fonteinen funk. Excellent.
Backlog. Had the pleasure of tasting this twice. One of the best beers ive ever had.

Bottle sampled. Pours dark pink-ish with a quickly dissipating light pink head. Huge aroma of barnyard, funk, raspberries, acidic and red fruits. Can smell it from meters away. Flavour is highly sour, light sweet. Complex, excellent blend. Medium bodied.

From notes. Bottle shared by Bytemesis. Thank you! Bottled April 2010. Aroma was dominated by Brett... with tart red fruit underneath.. VERY wine like! Very captivating. Layers of Brett, barnyard, tart cherries, and cherry pie filling linger on the finish. Very powerful flavor and acidity. Very dry finish. Very enjoyable experience. Don't blend it!

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours beautiful clear deep pink, tiny pink head, some lacing. Aroma is quite funky, barnyard and horse blanket, lots of cherry as well. Flavor is very cherry forward, quite tart with just a light residual sweetness. Funk is fairly light as well, accenting the cherry nicely. Light plus body, low carbonation. This was yummy.

Dark red with brown hue, no foam. Very slight aroma, some cherry, some horse blanket, wood. Strong tart character, dries the mouth, beautiful natural cherry flavor, lactic. Outstanding. If the smell was stronger this would be just about perfect.

Drunk from 75cl bottle. Bought directly from the 3 Fonteinen brewery/blender. Lovely sharp taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy red of color with a small white head. An aroma of red berries, sweets and dry. A flavor of red berries, sour and dry.

Bottle split at JFs, from an IP trade @ Borfets V, 03/11/13.
Murky claret with a good sized crimson head that dissipates to nothing fairly pronto.
Nose is a big smoked cherry blast, burnt cherry dipped straw, tartened cherry skins left to wither, cobwebs, oaky woody tones.
Taste comprises rich soured cherries, burnt cherry dipped straw, funky, tarte cherry skin, soured berry fruit compote.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, grassy finish dominated by ... you guessed it, tarte cherry notes.
Top draw fruit lambic!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared with kermis @ Klooster. Pours deep hazy red. Tart aroma of cherries. Taste is dry, tart cherries.
2008 750ml bottle at hopleaf Chicago. Pours a dark murky red with a light pink head. Slight tart cherry taste. Great beer

75cl traded bottle a couple years old now. Really a nice fruit lambic. When it is cooler you get much more of the tart lambic flavors but as it warms the cherries really appear, both meaty-sweet and tart. Interesting because for me lambics typically get acidic as they warm. Tasty.
750mL 2008 bottle pours a dark ruby with a thin pink head. Aroma is slightly sweet, light Brett, and dry funk. Very tart, cardboard, fruits, sour.

10/17/2008 Bottle Huge Thanks to Changeup..Thanks gary..Pour is redish pink with a thin whiteish pink head...Nose is funk, cherries, sweetness, grass, horseblanket...Taste is sweetness with some tingling funky tartness, light tart cherry,sweet tarts, nice soft finish with cherry.

Bottled: 6/28/10
A: Reddish/Purple Hue, Passes Mild Light, Pinkish Head, Almost No Lacing

S: Tart Cherries, Citrus Rind, Cranberry, Musty

T: Tart Cherries, Cranberry, Sour Mash

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter, Mildly Acidic

Overall, pretty sold tart cherry flavor as stated, the acidic flavor is there but not over powering to the point of making a sour face everytime you sip it.

Bottle shared with Simonsen, edvard & daje
Red hazy, white laces. Smells of cherries, funk, fruity berry aromas, very nice and refreshing. Light sweet, medium sour, tart cherries, very fruity, good dry mouthfeel, very refreshing, moderate bitter finish. Very nice kriek
Bottle at WTWBA. Reddish pour. Quite tart - cherries are prominent. Smooth and awesome. Great beer
Flaske fra Esp0r.Drukket på hytta til Dag. Bottled. Rødaktig farge med tynt skumlag.Lav karbonering. Smaker av kirsebær,sitrus,gjær, tre. En utrolig god surøl

Bottled. Hazy pale amber with reddish hue and thin off-white head. Sweetish cherries, bit of marzipan, light christmas tones in aroma. More of some sour cherries in taste, some very light funky notes too. Easy drinking with quite nice flavors in the end. Some christmas notes appears towards the finish as well.

3.5 A: Well hazed cherry plum color. Just about a finger of frothy pink head. Retention isnt great and no lacing is left.

4.5 S: Big, bold tart cherry - very welcoming. Like most 3F brews, this has a minimal acetic sourness and plenty of funk. Tangy fruity funk from lactic acid, musty basement, sweat socks, dry dusty wood planks. Light mixed berry noes underneath. Oak with a touch of vanilla. Touch of garbage-like funkiness to round this out. Very complex in the funk department and great interplay with the cherry. I guess I could use a little more sourness, but Id take this any day over Cantillons ass-puckering sourness.

4.5 T: The taste gives a nice tart punch that wasnt present in the nose. Theres also more acetic sourness that I would have expected if you know what I mean when I differentiate between tartness and sourness. Cherry is definitely a big part of the taste and is quite potent. Just enough sweetness to balance the sourness. The funk, however, either isnt as strong as in the nose or is just hidden behind the rising components of the taste. However, the funk is still easily detectable and adds to the complexity quite a bit, it just isnt as strong as in the nose. Musty basement, apple orchard, sweat socks, and dry wood. Oak with plenty of vanilla. Very nice.

3.5 M: Lighter medium body. Carbonation is on the lower end, but is fine. The issue I have is that the carbonation isnt very spritzy, which is something I like in these sort of styles. Light creaminess. Super smooth.

4.0 D: Another quality beer from 3F. A funk lovers kriek to be sure.

Poured from a 2011 750 mL bottle into a tulip.

There is a soft pop as the cork is released, and the pour into my glass has an energetic level of carbonation.  The beer itself is a hazy dark pink rapsberry color throughout, with a few resplendent bubbles visibly rising from the bottom of glass.  A gentle off-white head relaxes to a ring around the edge for most of the glass.

A robust cherry aroma is not overly strong but is definitely the most noticeable aroma.  At first the cherries seem sweet and creamy, but there is a slightly sharp tartness that adds a little bit of an edge.   Lemony lambic notes, tannic cherry skin, and some oaky red wine notes.  As it warms the farmyard funk comes through, although it is not dominant by any means.

The Schaerbeekse cherries come through immediately.  Once the fruit base is set, the tartness starts to build, bringing in notes of lemon and oak, and a bit of tannic vinous fruit.  The lambic in the form of lactic acidity and the sweet cherries play off of each other for the majority of the sip.  Just a bit of Bretty funk adds a background complexity.  There is a mineral note in the finish.   

As compared to some other fruit lambics, this has a somewhat richer body and creamier nature.  The carbonation is smooth and gentle as opposed to crisp, which makes it feel undercarbonated at times.  In reality, it is simply more of a subtle carbonation to go along with its subtle flavor.  Even though it is tart and sour, I do not sense that it is overly acidic.

I enjoyed drinking this Kriek for sure.  My fruit lambic preference goes to Cantillon, but this is a serious lambic.

Pours a deep cherry/cranberry color with minimal lacing that is sporadic and barely any head on this beauty. Small carbonation volcano in the very center of my glass that does not go away. Aromas are the rarest, most sour cherry notes with tons of wild yeast, vanilla, squirell urine and loads of vintage aged oak wood. Taste is vinous, buttery, smooth, crisp, dry all rolled into one with flavors of dark whole cherries, crab, oak, malt, vanilla from the barrel, zest. This beer tingles the senses and mouth while leaving a beautiful pronounced aftertaste that never gets old. Perfectly carbonated, perfectly balanced, perfectly crafted, Perfect Lambic. Amazing brew drank in celebration of a new member to the family. Cheers!
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 dark red in color with little head. great tart cherry lambic taste and not overly sweet like others.

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 26.02.2012
Aroma is tart and sour with lots of earthy notes and some farmhouse aroma. Flavour is tart and sour with cherry juice, earthy notes and some manure. Palate is very low on CO2. Nice, although I expected this to be more extreme. Too much berry juice and too low on sourness. Definitely not bad still.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 Bottle to tulip (thanks Dutchs).  Looks good; black cherry with nice CO2.  Smells decent.  Tastes solid; the blend of the cherries and the base is great.  Mouthfeel is good too.  Overall, a tasty treat that Id definitely seek out again for special occasions.

Picked this up for $30 USD at Hunger Mountain Co-Op. Bottle April 26th, 2011. Poured into a white wine glass right from my cellar at 55 Degrees F. Shared with the GF who LOVES Kriek Lambic.

A - Nice hiss on the cork pop but not an intense pressure I expected. Poured a 2-finger off-red head with big bubbles that dissipates instantly in my glass. Deep blood red color beer with some nice bubbles in the glass. Theres some slight alcohol fingers on the glass which is surprising for a low ABV beer.

S - Gigantic funkiness on first sniff. Lots of tang and tart in that first bit of sniff. The cherries come into the scent soon after followed by some wood and earthy notes that I imagine was passed on from the barrel aging. The tartness feels like it burns my nose hairs its so strong.

T - Gigantic mouth puckering sour taste turns my tongue upside down. Pretty amazing. The cherry is there but not as intense as expected. Theres a great oak taste on the back of my tongue and cherry / oak is left over after swallowing. The sour is so intense so if youre not in LOVE with sour, this will put you on your butt.

M - A big mouth swish gives me 60/40 bubbles to liquid. Great linger of the cherries and very light bodied.

O - Worth $30? Id say so if youre a big sour lover. The same bottle costs a lot less in Belgium but then theres that pesky plane ticket. I think this is a great beer but $10 cheaper would have been nice.

Bottle.  Pours cloudy ruby with a thin, fizzy pink head; short retention and spare lacing.  Aroma is sour fruit and black cherries with some maple and spice.  Flavor is heavy fruit esters with faint supporting malt; sweet finish.  Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Bottle shared by hu5om at BenCs huge BCS tasting - Ruby red pour with next to no head. Tart cherry juice on the nose--very sour--with a nice musty, funky sweaty sock character. Real tart and funky taste, lots of Sweet Tarts and sour cherry juice. Puckering finish--its sour as hell--though really refreshing. Fairly thin and pretty effervescent. I was blown away by this--awesome stuff.

Bottle. Deep red color with a tiny white head. Funky sour nose, yeast, barnyard. Cherries, bright fruit flavor. Flavor is beautiful, delicate sourness, funky yeast and cheese. Once you acclimatize to the sourness, the clarity of the cherries really comes through. Wonderful flavor. Complex. Dry finish. Light, easy to drink. Very light carbonation. Overall, fantastic beer. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 2004 vintage. Pours unclear dark red with a white head. Aroma of cherry, raspberry, vinegar, black olives, woody, lacto acid, sulfur, and alot of funky wild yeasty notes. Taste of cherry, delicate funk, oak, raspberry, olives, sulfur, got that rural feel to it, citrus peel, quite some brett and lacto acid. Still pretty fruity and very nice! Got a newer vintage and this was a much more fruity experience. Lots of juicy cherry and marzipan notes along with a nice amount of funk. This is Complex and awesome indeed.

bottled august 28th 2010. pours a bright clean and hazy pink and ruby red. pretty much no head what so ever on this. very still looking. bright cherry flavor, very vibrant and fresh. lots of oak combined to really add some depth. very tart up front. cherry flavor then emerges and and carries through out, finishing sour. light oak through out although towards the finish it pops out to combine with the sour. not much funk if any. very light carbonation with a bit of tingle. very dry through out. mouth just puckers. overall, i was a bit let down considering the high price tag associated with it. the regular drie fonteinen kriek has a bit of a better cherry flavor. quite good, i had no issues drinking this and if the price was cut back drastically, i would buy this far more often. Reviewed on: 05-31-2011

750ml bottle dated October 17, 2008.

Pours a deep murky cranberry with a short-lived fizzy pink head that recedes immediately and leaves no lacing.

Aroma is full of tart cherries and a little bit of brown sugar.  There is a hefty lactic acid component alongside more subtle oak and brett notes.

The cherries are also big up front on palate but are immediately swept away by the oaky tannins and earthy funk.  The sugar and cherries are still there but the tartness is a little more pronounced.

The mouthfeel is dry, almost feels like a wine on the palate with the fruity tartness and oak mixing together.

This is a fantastic beer and one that I have taken for granted as it sits on the shelf while the Cnatillon flies off next to it.  Big fan.

Purchased at the 3 Fonteinen bottle shop!  Pours deep ruby red with a small pink head.  Nose is sour cherries and earthy wood and soil.  Very robust and rich frangrances.  Taste is very earthy bitter and sweet up front but finished with a great sweet and sour blance.  Mouthfeel is creamy and a bit fizzy but more smooth than any 3 Foneinen beer I have ever had.  Long dry aftertaste.  Amazing.
Pours a clear pink with huge white head.  Aroma of, you guessed it, sour cherries!  Flavor is rich and complex with the yeast really showing off what they can do!

Bottle 2004 Vintage. Pours murky red with a small white head, Aroma: Very woody, bark, minerally, tart cherries, sulfur, red berries, brett, yeast, barnyard, lemony notes, vanilla, sour, acidity, marzipan, cherry pits, meaty. Taste, some sweetness, meaty, acidic, heaps of tart cherries, iron, minerally, brett, barnyard, sulfur, some lacto notes, stable, fruity, sweet berries, oak, vanilla, marzipan, nutty, cherry pits,

Poured into a stemmed glass from 750ml bottle dated April 26, 2011.

A: Murky dark red body with a thin pink foamy head that has decent retention and forms a thick and dense ring as it disappears. 

S: Some oak and a lot of sourness. I cant pick anything else out as the sourness is overbearing and is a bit chemical smelling.

T: Very sour, reminds me of an atomic warhead, without the sweetness. Not a fan.

M: Light and fizzy.

O: I did not like this at all, I wound up pouring it after a few sips. I couldnt get over the sourness.

Pour ruby red with white head. Aroma bo, funk, straw, sour cherry. Taste sour cherry, funk, wood, hay, dry, earthy. MF medium body fizzy carb. Very tasty sour well brewed and interesting. Thanks Robinvboyer!!!

Smells like sweet tart cherries with undertones of cough syrup. Beautiful clear ruby red body with a thin pastel pink head. Tastes of tart cherries at first with a gentle malt backbone on the finish, not too dry. Very easy drinking and well-balanced, could do an entire bottle of this. Overall probably one of my favorite krieks.

Bottled April 26, 2011 - Poured into some Goose Island stemware.  Beautiful cherry red body with a thin layer of pink foam.  Musty barnyard brett and lightly soured cherries on the nose.  Wet hay and a bit of cheese.  The flavor is filled with dry, tart, cherries and light, earthy, malt in the background.  The cherries in this are excellent.  The body is smooth and creamy with a nice tart/sour kick.  Light, spritzy bubbles.  Slightly more acidic than I remember the regular Oude Kriek being.  Overall, this is pretty tasty stuff.  I personally like it more than the Oude Kriek, but probably still prefer Cantillons Kriek, especially with the $28 price tag on this bottle.
Bottle shared at the RBWG in Austin.  Deep red pour with an off-white head.  Smells and tastes of puckeringly sour fruit and funky cherry.

Thanks to Chipalsa for picking this one up. I owe him one. Nose is tart cherries and mildewed leaves. Dank. The body is marvelous with a ruby hue and an almost violet color in the light. Awesome. Taste is bitter, sour cherries with a tannic hint. Dry as hell, but good for sure. I appreciate what this beer does but its not one of those beers I could drink every day.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2012 This one caught me by surprise. For a kriek, the earthy fruity tones created the musk of a geuze. While tart and fruity, the mellow and oaky undertones created a complex balance of sweet and sour. Id like to try some more 3 Fonteinen please.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy red with off white head. The aroma is sour cherry and tart. Medium mouthfeel with sour fruit and tart finish. A very good lambic.

Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012 - Day 1. Deep red, with a pink head. Aroma of sour cherries, wood and almond. Flavor is quite sour, tart, dominated by fresh sour cherries. Sour till the finish. Next to Lou Pepe Kriek, this was for my taste a bit inferior.

Pours a very appealing deep raspberry red with a pink hued flash in the pan head. The nose reveals a heavy dose of musty funk followed by overripe cherries. Digging deeper I find some oak and a bit of a lactic edge. Starts off quite sour but not brutally so, sour gives way to sweet cherry notes and the funk comes in on the back end. Its been awhile since Ive had 3Fs Oude Kriek but from memory Id say I prefer the Schaerbeekse. Definitely a fuller cherry presence. It leaves my mouth watering after every sip. I could do with a bit less carbonation but it isnt unbearable by any means. I was able to buy this for $22 before the price hike and it was well worth the cost of admission.

Aroma:frisk kirsebær eddike Ud.:rød uklar Skum:  E.smag:sød lidt sur moderat  bitter lidt Krop: medium For.:tør Brus:blød 
Super dejlig som en øl man bliver glad af ;-)  
27/1-12 @f1

Bottle shared with friends.  Pours a deep red/orange with very light white head.  Aroma is cherry through and through with some cinnamon notes. Taste is sour to start with a heavy dose of cinnamon and bitter cherry at the finish and a tiny bit of vanilla which could have been from the glass.  The sourness isnt totally mouth puckering but something that would be easy to have a full glass of.  Overall, an outstanding beer as always from 3F.  Glad this stuff is available on the shelf but wish the price were a little better.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Beautiful hazy, red color with a pink head. A lot of almonds and cherry in the nose. Taste is very sour, no bitternes.

Bottle shared at the awesome bbq arranged by Alex from 4:20 for MesandSims stag do. Beer courtesy of Alex too. What a top bloke. Obviously the aroma and flavour are heavily dominated by cherries but this is much more complex than the initial awesome hit of cherries. The tartness is pretty much perfect. Nobody does it better.

Had two bottles of this fine beer on Saturday, looks as though its going to be sweet when you first pour the beer, lots of nice cherry aroma, but as soon as you taste it the nice tart cherry taste comes our, damn the Belgians are good at these beers!!

[Rated 09/07/2010] Bottle. Pours ruby red, like wine with very thin fizzy head. I can smell the cherries as I am pouring. Aroma is mild, a little sweet and not too bitter and as I was preparing for similar taste I was very surprised to find that flavor is precisely the opposite -- bitter with no hints of sugars. The feel on the palete is still very mild. Leaves a nice light finish with hints of cherries. Often I can sense metallic off-flavors in some cheaper and less-developped lambics (gueuzes mainly, but sometimes krieks, too). Not this one, this beer is truly a matvel, a ruby red marvel.

Pours a dark rubied red with a thin, quick whitish cover.  Aroma is fruity, some acidic tartness cuts through preventing it from being sweet .  Taste is nice cherry, black cherry warhead, lightly tart, but not overpowering the fruit, still sweet and fleshy.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy ruby red with a pinkish head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice earthy funk with a nice tart but sweet cherry note. Flavor begins with tart cherry but has a bit of sweetness in the finish with some dryness.

2011 vintage. New Years Eve beer! Pours a beautiful deep ruby red and a small bubbly fuchsia head. Nose tons of funky yeast, mold, sour cherry, hay, and earth. Flavor is complex and presents more sweet & sour cherry aspects than the nose, oak, red wine vinaigrette. grapefruit, lemon and acidity. Finishes tart and dry. Lighter bodied and wonderful drinking beer.

75cl bottle at Christmas. Pours a beautiful ruby colour with a pink head that dies away to thin lacing early. The aroma is beautifully tart with Schaerbeekse cherries, almonds, light lemon and balsamic vinegar. Tastes quite tart also with cheek-puckering cherries, lemon, balsamic and almonds again. Moderate carbonation and a dry tart finish. Flavours linger on nicely.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours slightly hazy deep red with a small head. Looks amazing, and the taste and aroma does not disappoint either. Heavy cherry aroma with barnyard. Delicious sour cherry taste with a hint of bitter almond. Sour, fresh and prickeling fruity. Amazing beer with a long pleasantly sour finish.

Wow this one poured beautifully with a delightfully pink pillow of a delicate head. Color is obviously similar and resembles rose colored red ink. Nose is pleasant and intense with full sweet cherries, flowers, wooden barrels, wine oken planks, sour blended cherries some light acetic notes and heavy lactic acids and lemons and funk. Flavor is purfumey cherries tart cherry pies, lactic acid, wood and dry red wines. Delicate and sour with a start of sweet then a crisp dry and sour finish. light and palatable.

4/28/2010 vintage 750ml into an over sized wine glass. Allowed to warm up to room temperature. 

A - Deep red body, very clear and juice like. I gave it an aggressive pour for the second glass and I got an off white/light pink head that fizzled away in seconds. Pouring the swirled dregs yields a cloudy dark pink/red liquid that looks like a raspberry smoothie. 

S - Sweet cherries followed by some brett funk. The cherry is very potent but sweet with hints of vanilla and cinnamon. Just very light and faint spices. The finish is oaky and sour.

T - Sour cherries followed by oak and brett funk. Very smooth and refreshing flavor. I can pick out some of that vanilla and cinnamon. Some lemony lactic action going as well. Tart and crisp carbonation. 

O - A fantastic kriek. It has a lot of complex sweetness to balance out the sour and tart flavors. I enjoyed it much more than the standard oude kriek, but the price tag is really difficult to swallow. Still glad I grabbed a bottle though.

One of my favorite sours. This is a beer I believe should be had. The sour of this beer is apparent right off the bat. The appearance for some reason surprised me. I have had this beer a few times before, but for some reason this pour was something else. It is a beautiful type of purple/pink that is bright and non transparent. Its a beautiful beer in all areas of rating. Cheers King James

75 cl. Bottle bought at Skjold Buur, Aarhus. Hazy red color with white head about 1 finger. Very acidic in the smell. a hint of the cherries, but not much at all.. the taste is very acidic. Notes of the yeast. All in all a beer that you either love or hate. For Lambic first-timers this is hardcore.

2008 750ml bottle pours a translucent, neon purple with one ring of pink head.  Nose is mild, lightly tart, cherries, a little funky, a little band aid.  Flavor is sweet, fruity, tart, funky, grass, flowers, raspberry, strawberry jam.  Full bodied, lightly acidic finish.  Well balanced and approachable.
Hazy red with a small white head. Sour with fruity tones. Fruit, acidic and sour. medium body with a bitter / sour after taste.

Bouteille de 750ml embouteillée le 28 avril 2010. Du grand art de Patrick. Le liquide est rouge et la mousse rose avait disparue en un clin doeil. Les brett sont bien présents aux nez, il y a des cerises aussi. La bouche est surette, très surette, les brett et les cerises dominent. Classique cette Kriek est tout ce quon attendait.

(From ontbeermaker, thanks!)  La robe est rouge et se présente sans tête.  Des parfums de cerises à la fois doux et surets marquent le nez.  Des arômes de basse-cour se renforcent au fil de la dégustation.  Les saveurs sont très agréables et démontrent tout un savoir-faire de la maison : les notes acides et surettes sont bien dosées, le fût est impeccable, les notes douces suffisantes.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps plutôt moyen avec une effervescence douce et une texture mince.  La finale est une attaque en règle contre les tissus de la langue, voire même un blitz contre la bouche.

Bottle pours deep red with little to no head at all. Aroma is tart cherries, funk and wood. Flavor is heavy on the tart cherries, but is nicely balanced by hints of funk and wood. Really like this beer. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Id have to agree, the taste and the nose is endearing - the ABV makes this hazardous. Great colour, looks like a frothy fruit juice with a fair to middling head, excellent nose, very fruity, very cherry, taste is full bodied, very sour and fruity, acidic and dry.

Cranberry pour no head just a thin ring .... aroma is of sour and tart cherry with light barnyard .... could smell this all day .... taste is very sour cherry tart, barnyard and very light oak ... dry sour cherry finish very well balanced flavors color is perfect .... amazing blend

Brownish orangish rusty reddish color, smaller pinkish head, some what is that mold in the bottom of the glass, im drinking it... aroma is somewhat sour with a distinct woodiness, definite cherry although my knowledge of the elusive schaerbeeke cherry is limited to this... fairly lively, medium bodied, very tart, loads of funk/sour notes, fairly fruity, but the cherrys not the dominant factor... when i swirl it it sounds like soda... great flavor, could pop a bit more carbonation wise, sourness fades a bit... any woodiness in the aroma doesnt really translate to the flavor...

Pours an opaque odd rosy color with a thin pink head...light sediment throughout.  Aroma is mildly sour with oakiness...vinous...underlying sweet cherry notes.  Flavor has nice sour cherry...significantly sour at first...lightly leathery and funky, oaky.  Mouthfeel is light and very silky...finish is vinous and dry with sour cherry notes.

2010 bottle.  Pour is deep red with light brown tones and a very small waft of light pink bubbles.  Very little head at all, I was afraid it was flat, but it was not.  Aroma is loaded with deep tart cherry notes, funky sock, hay, country side, and  a touch off wood.  Flavor is absolutely delightful.  Very much a two layered experience. The dominant base flavor is an intensely tart cherry note that starts strong and then slowly fades without every really going away.  The other flavor that is present throughout is clean funk and light wood.  This is so well balanced and refreshing.  The tart flavor is such that I just want another sip after each is finished. Almost puckering, but just enough sweetness to carry it though perfectly.  Better than I expected.

2008 bottle shared with my wife (Amy). Pours.a beautiful red with little head and no lacing. Nose is sour, funky barnyard but just right. First sip is tart with pale malty flavors. Amzing balance for a sour. Finish is clean with jjst the right amount of lingering slour. Amazing beer.

Color morado oscuro con suave espuma rosa.Aroma dulce a cereza y madera con un toque acido.Sabor medio dulce/acido muy equilibrado.
Fantastica!
All I can say is this is one of the beat sours Ive ever had!  Great pour great finish. All around amazing

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 750ml bottle from Premier Gourmet, Buffalo.  $39.  Bottled 28 APR 2010.  Pours a thick, cloudy blood red.  Has a head initially but dissipates fast.  Smells funky, sour, cherry.  Im also getting a bit of oak.  Beautiful nose.  Im tasting bitter oak, cherries, and funky sour.  This is a complex beer.  Im going to go ahead and also say that this may be the best beer Ive ever had.

Bottle at Kulminator vintage 2005... it pours cloudy dark red with a quick disappearing pink head.... the aroma is cherries, almond and sour.... the flavor is sweet, sour, acidic and fruits... I really enjoyed this !....
(Bottle 25/10-2011) No head, clear red color, sour cherry aroma, very dry sour taste. Bottled 20-04-2010, BB date 28 AVR 2020.

Cloudy dark red with a disappearing pink head. Aroma is sweet, cherries, almond and moderate sour - wood. Flavor is medium sweet, rather sour and rather acidic. Bone dry and rather acidic finish. Absolutely amazing. 251011

Sample at SBWF 2011. Bottle. Red/pink, cloudy liquid with small light pink head with absolutely no retention. Aroma is sour with notes of cherries, apples, barnyard, horseblanket and lemons. Fruity. Taste is highly sour, tart, very dry with very low bitterness. Notes of cherries.  Huge complexity, really nice. Medium bodied with low carbonation and dry mouthfeel. Really tasty one, feels complex and almost balanced even though its very sour.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 New rating from December 2016: 75cl bottle at the brewery tap room. It pours a deep dark ruby color with a thin layer of pink head. Aroma is greatly complex and jammy fruity, with super tart cherries and almond notes, alongside some oaky vanilla, lemon peel and juice sourness and barnyard funk. Taste is siilarly bold and complex, with various layers of basement funk, fruity tart cherries and almonds, oaky vanilla, tart lemon notes. Medium bodied with crispy fine carbonation. Overall, a masterclass in complexity this beer, really. Score 4.4
Original rating from October 2011: 75cl bottle. Vintage 2008. Pours a cloudy ruby /brownish colour with a little off-white head. Aroma is tons of cherries and horseblanket. Lightly sweet, quite acidic flavor, becomes moderately sour. Taste is really complex and fruity, but not sweet at all. Really sour, but still balanced thanks to the fruity presence. Acidic, pretty dry finish. Medium body, lively carbonation. Awsome. Score 4.1leaves,

0.75l bottle. Guess its time to pop this one before it gets to old. It pours a lovely deep and light clouded burgundy-red body with quite a few big sediments and a small fading and quickly sidesticking light pinkish head. The aroma quickly fills the room with tart and sour notes. When smelling the glass I get some sweet almond-like notes, lots of sour cherries, some sharp funky tones and hints of sweet marzipan. Lovely! It has a average carbonation level, medium-bodied and the mouthfeel is light oily, gliding and perhaps a bit sticky as well. Flavors start off kinda dry and tart, and the tartness spreads through my mouth quite gently and soft before it kinda changes in to these green and yellow sour apples and lemon flavors. Continues with lots of cherries and brett but there is also a mild sweetness wrapped nicely in the end here. Its just so well balanced that its newer on the point where its to gastric or sour and thats really nice. Solid stuff!

750ml, corked & caged, 2010 bottle split with LJ. pours a gorgeous, cranberry red, with a fizzy, pink head and very little retention but leaves light rings of lace. aroma is damn nice with tart red fruits, musty, horseblanket, wheat grass, and sweet cherries backed by light vinegar, red wine, and funky oak as it warms. flavor is great with a nice balance of tart cherries, berries, and grapes and funky yeast, dry grass, and wet wood backed by dry red wine. palate is medium bodied with crisp carbonation and a dry, oaked, funky finish. overall, a damn nice sour.

Sampled @ SBWF on September 29. Pours deep red with a small white head. Smell is sour with cherries and some complex yeasty notes. Taste is very sour with a subtle bitterness and tartness and is incredibly complex. Theres some vinegar and lots of sour cherries. Ive had this several times now and Im pretty sure this is the perfect beer!
Sampled at SB & WF 2011. Pours red with no real head. Smells fruity and sour. Tastes sour with a sour charry finish.

this poured a ruby red color with a tiniy pinkish white head. Aroma was lots of funk and barnyard, followed by yeast laiden sour cherries nad light oak.  Flavor was much the same, more acidic cherries than sour yeast funk. Another solid offering from 3 Fonteinen.

Bottle from whole foods with Linh, Ken VI and Thi. Pours deep, hazy ruby red body with pink lacing. Aroma is indoor swimming pool, tart,  and ripe cherries. Mouthfeel is puckering tart cherries, slight sour dryness and maybe some funky cheese.
Deep red to purple colour, head instantly gone. Smells white wine, sour, cellar, wood. Tastes cranberry, sour, acidic. Dry, medium body.

Bottle generously shared by Clyx. Gothenburg, February 2011

Pours hazy deep red with a small white-pink head. Big sour aromas of tart cherries - and other red berries, vinegar, barnyard and funk. Extremly sour, theres a real acid burn to it. Big cherry flavour with a tartness and seed character. There is a small sweetness but other then that this is just an inferno of sour cherries! Amazing.

I drank the 2011 compared to the 2010 last week.
The 2010 is much more sour then the 2011, which has more cherry taste and aroma. Although the 2010 is sometimes a bit too sour in my opinion, the 2011 might have some more soureness to it. But overall, as we are used to Schaarbeekse Kriek, still one of the best, if not the best Kriek beers available.
Bottle, pours a really nice red. this one had a good sweetness and it was very tart, good amount of sourness. I liked this one a lot.
Bottle purchased in Brussels. Poured dark red with little pinkish head. Very tart sourness with lots of cherry aromas and flavours. Very nice smooth, sour finish.

Bottle in Rome during The Stag Do. Vintage 2008. Pours red with a big, pink head. Huge sour nose, some berries. Flavor, too, is extremely sour, great cherry notes. Very dry, moderately sweet. Excellent beer.

bottle says 5% alc, bbe 04/2015. Nice but fast disappearing pink head on a beautiful red colored beer. Aroma of straw-rope/horseblanket and soft sour cherries. Acidic, like lemonjuice, red berries and cherry-stones. Expected it to be more fruity ...

1000th rating, and quite possibly my last.  I drank this at my sisters wedding last weekend.  It pours a brilliant read with a beautiful pink head.  The aroma and flavor were both overwhelmingly of fresh tart cherries.  It was aggressively sharp and acidic, but the fruitiness certainly shined through as well.  It definitely had quite a bit of funk to it, most notably an eggy cheesy quality as it warmed.  Medium body and super spritzy on the palate.  It wasnt the best lambic I have ever had, but it was certainly worthy of my thousandth, and probably last, rating.  Cheers for now folks.
Pours opaque blood red. Aroma or funk, slightly sweet. Taste is extreme sourness. Sweet cherry edge balances it out.
Funky smell. As per Lambic. Hint of fruit but the generak rajness of this badboy brings to mind a geuze. So sour. So raj. This is unbelievable produce.

Bottle @ home shared with Joes and DutchDrebus. The color looks like cassis-limonade: nice clear red color. Smells sour, more like a geuze, and cellar. Taste light fruity and sour. Very nicely balanced.

Bottle at Maltzillas tasting. 2010 vintage. Pours reddish pink color with pink head. Tart cherry aroma with barnyard funkiness and dankness. Sour cherry flavor with tons of funkiness. Light to medium body with lively carbonation. Thanks Ryan!

Big big props go to Dstructo for sharing this gem of  a beer. Reddish color with a thick bubbly red head. The cherries are the biggest culprit in the aroma  here along with subtle  hints of  vanilla. Flavor is just tart sour goodness. Hits you right in the back  of the jaw. Outstanding.

Big thanks to Destructo for sharing this gem.  Clear garnet pour with a pink head.  Tantalizing fruit and funk aromas.  Ohh man this is tart.  Loaded with all kinds of sour cherries, tart raspberries, barnyard funk, and vinegar...

2005 bottle thanks to AJ.  Pours a hazy dark cherry color with a white -pink tinged rim head.  Aroma is seductive and pleasing -barnyard funk, cherry, oak, and some vinegar.  Lots of cherry flavor without the sweetness, lots of sour and tart.  Just spectacular!

Truly a remarkable beer, the craftsmanship is so defined in this beer that you can tell not every brewer would be able to make it this well. The color and aroma scream at you to take a sip, and the sou/sweet plays in your mouth. Wonderful.

Bottle. Pours a brilliant pinkish colour with rocky very light pink head. Brilliant aromas of sour cherries, almonds and some barnyard funk. Flavour wise lots of sourness, though not over powering, some earthy funk and a little acid. Medium mouthfeel. Great stuff.

750 ml bottle.  Bottled in April 2010.  Pours a dark red with small white head that has decent retention and leaves a fair amount of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is huge cherry, some cherry pits, some lactic acid, light barnyard funkiness, and just the smallest hint of acetic acid.  Awesome.  The taste is again huge with cherry flavor without sweetness, cherry pits, a decent amount of sourness, with a good lactic tartness on the finish.  Medium body.  Low carbonation.  I found the carbonation to be a bit low and felt the beer would have definitely benefited from more carbonation.  Still a phenomenal beer. Wonderful aroma that means only one thing... LAMBIC! Casual aromas that waft up from the glass are wonderful fruity cherry vapors. When you smell deeply thought, the lambic aroma hits you in and teleports you right to Beersel. I drift between the aromas of chewy cherry and wonderfully sour lambic. Smooooooooth... Wow! Almost nothing up front. Then the sourness creeps up on you. Then the cherry arrives at the party. Clean and dry. I will have to drink it sooner the next time it is available to enjoy more cherry flavor. Still, this is not a brute of a lambic like some others, it is very refined and subdued instead of in-your-face. I really wish I was drinking this in Beersel at some cafe.  Make no mistake, I enjoy those in-your-face, Im a real lambic and Im going to kick your ass with my lambicness, kind of lambics, but this one is gentle and easy drinking. Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a hazy, near-murky pink body with a small, pinkish-white head. Nose is sour cherries, wood, and brett tones; all very subtle but highly inviting. The first sip proves to be interesting: at first, it appears sweet and bubbly on the palate, with cherries and funky brett flavors: farmstead hay, basement yeast, hints of hay. Then, the whole thing dissipates into a delicious, intensely sour, tart assault on the senses, before finally converging with the initial cherry-and-brett flavors. Extremely well composed, like a symphony of taste where each section of the orchestra know exactly when to appear and make an impact. Sour tarty cherry flavors go hand in hand with a very nicely balanced sweetness all the way through the aftertaste. The Schaerbeekse Kriek distinguishes itself with having a lot of cherry flavor while avoiding the pitfalls of the potentially sickening, artificial-like cherry sweetness of other krieks - even those using only natural ingredients. Truly a great brew, and by far the best Ive had in the genre. Gotta get more of those bottles before theyre gone!

Bottled in October 2008. Consumed 03.15.2010.

A: Pours a bright ruby red with a nice light pink head that eventually settles into a nice ring around the edge of the glass.

S: Lots of cherries alongside a little bit of sweetness. The cherry component of this one has held up quite well over the year-and-a-half since it was bottled. Behind the cherry is a little bit of lactic acid alongside some oak. The cherry definitely takes the center stage, which diminishes what could otherwise be a fairly complex lambic.

T: Again, lots of cherries upfront. Here, however, the oak and lactic sourness come more into play. As Drie Fonteinen intended, there is no acetic acid in this one, leaving the lactic and cherry to play off one another nicely, with just the slightest touch of oak in the background.

M: Thin and refreshing with moderate carbonation. More acidic on my tongue than cheeks and throat, but a very nice mouthfeel nonetheless. Not super-sour, but also not terribly sweet.

D: Low abv with a near-perfect level of lactic sourness. This is one to be savored, but one that I could easily knock back a few of.

Serving type: bottle
