15/10/2010 - 75cl bottle @ Klaas place Thanks to Klaas for the bottle! 
Pours a clear deep ruby red beer, little pink adhesive head. Aroma holds the bretta, some citrus, green apples. But no cherries in the nose. Taste has citrus, quite some acidity but still fruity. Aftertaste holds more of the same. I dont know why, but for some reason this is missing out on the fruitiness of cherries. Maybe the bottle... it calls for a re-tasting.
Ar: 5, Ap: 4, T: 4, P: 4, O: 11, Total: 2.8

Bottled October 2008.  Pour is a very pretty deep red to magenta in color with a large pink head.  Big funky aroma.  Barnyard, lemon, and a hint of cherry are present.  Flavor is tart cherry and very acidic.  Hint of sweet cherry flavors mid palate and the the finish is once again super tart.  Something was missing from the flavor.  Im a big fan of super tart beers and this had that going for it.  My teeth were left stinging after drinking this.

Bottle, tfs Vaiz! Deep ruby red, tanned head.
Aroma is very fruity with some barnyard and brett.
Flavour is soft bretty with notes of barnyard and dust. 
Nice one.

2008 vintage 75cl bottle at home. Fruity aroma with some faint wood, makes it slightly similar to Flemish old browns. The flavor however is very distinct kriek, but very smooth and round. Nice brew. Wonder how it would be if fresh.

Bottled 75cl (alc. 5%, vintage 03/2005, 35% of Schaerbeekse cherries, bought from Bierkoning, Amsterdam in July 2005) My 1000th rated Belgian beer.
Deep ruby color, tiny pinky head. Sophisticated lambic aroma: sour cherries, fruityness and some barnyard. Soft palate, medium-bodied. Dry, tart flavor, same time highly drinkable. Red wineish tannines, red grapes, sour cherry fruitness, some wood and light notes of barnyard. Seems that you can age this for years, perhaps 10+ years. Kriek at its best.

Shared with sparky, nbutler and daknole.  Thanks gentlemen!  Pours cloudy with an orange-red color and white head.  Smells of funk and cherries.  Taste is sour/tart, but not over done.  Medium bodied with thin texture.  Nice beer with some sweet/sour cherry flavors.  A nice palate refresher after the stouts/porters of earlier.  Had a duck appetizer prepared by hellbilly and it was the perfect beer flavorwise and to cut through the fat.  Great way to end the evening.

Shared medium sized bottle. Poured a red color with a small, slightly pink head. Aroma was tart cherries, heavy sour notes, touch of oak. Flavor was sour cherries, oak, vanilla, very tart. Certainly a change from the typical sweet lambics I have.

09 bottle. Thanks to Savvy1982 for the share! Pours bright pink/red. Nice head with fine carbonation. The aroma is funky, full, spicy and full of cherries. The flavor has a tun of cherries, is quite musty and has a lot of clove, spice, fruit and funk. Really nice.

Poured by Armand at 3 Fonteinen. Pours deep red/bordeaux with a thick pink head. Aroma is a lot of cherries and very inviting to take a first sip. Taste is very well balanced between the tartness and sweetness with some woody notes. A true classic!

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 (750 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pannuhuone, Kuopio. Rated @ 24.6.2010.)
Pours a beautiful deep red colour without any foam. Aroma is full of aged cherries and nothing else. Just pure cherries on the nose. Awesome sourness on the taste with notes of wood and acidity. Medium bodied and very fruit-driven taste with a nice oak-dry finish which lasts for long. Awesome beer.8-4-8-4-16 4.0
750 ml bottle, third time.
Massive cherry notes on the nose, flavour ensues the same. Extremely well balanced and feels like a fine wine really. Much better than their Intense Red or Oude Kriek (tasted in a vertical tasting). 9-4-9-4-16

Sample taste from someone shared at the Bruery. Poured a reddish color with off white reddish head. Aroma was funky, phenolic with some oak tannins and cherries. Taste was very dry yet tart with cherries. Pretty good.

Bottle, shared with mrbunn.  Pours a murky, cloudy, foamless hue the color and consistency of pomegranate juice.  Aroma is flat sour berries... maybe a touch of green apple sneaking in there, but mostly, fermented berries.  First taste is an initial blast of sour, but then seems to level off, too quickly, to a semi-flat taste, almost watery.  2nd taste... completely different.  It holds the sour taste much longer, and reveals a pretty excellent balance.  Mouthfeel is medium, and the beer really coats the tongue.  Pretty good stuff, but I am going to reserve judgement until it warms up more, as I suspect there is a lot hidden behind the overly chilled state of the beer at the moment.   Okay, after letting it warm some more, the flavors really come out and the ultra sour, followed by semi-flatness, is gone.  Palate is lovely, cherry, pomegranate sour, followed by a red grape sweetness, and a final settled return to gentle sour that is really quite pleasing.  Nice one.  Thanks Joel.

Bottle shared with gordito.  Pours a very odd and dark reddish purple with tons of little bubbles sticking to the sides of the glass and a thin and fizzy pink head.  Even as the cork pops, I can pick up loads of tart aromas.  Closer inspection reveals a wonderful aroma of vinegar (apple cider?) and tart cherries.  First sip is a little odd... seems to watery with a lot of pie cherries and a lemon peel finish.  After sitting and warming for a good 20 minutes this has become absolutely splendid.  The flavors are more robust, the cherries really pop and the lemony finish is much more full.  I feel a little stupid for having started with this as cold as it was...  I know better.  (And let that be a cautionary tale for all...)
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle sample.  Hazy dark red pour, little carbonation and an aroma of strong sweet cherry, sour.  Flavor was super sour right of the bat, little cherry and finished a little woody/sugary.  Very good, I will be trying to find some of this before it disappears.

Bottle bought at Dranken Geers in Belgium. Shared at home with my beautifull wife to celebrate four months as man and wife!!! The pour is dark ruby red with a pink head that looks almost artificial. A real beauty. The nose is mild with cherrys and wodden notes with a little twist of metal and some mild sourness as from young grapes. The taste is rusty with a long lasting expression where the taste of cherries keeps going out to a finish that are both sweet and bitter. Here and there hints of oak but constantly you sense the presents of tons of fruit. The palate is nice medium but at the same time fruity-wise thick with a nice dryness. The finish is long and dry. Try to burb...damn its tasty.

Mfielden on BA says that no beer is perfect, that they approach perfection asymptotically. Apparently he has never had Schaerbeekse Kriek.

At first there isnt much to it - cherries, wood, cherry pits, lactic acid, and musk. But it fills the mouth without being heavy. Its fruit forward but not sweet. It is in fact perfectly balanced.

I bought multiple bottles to confirm. Each expressed the same delicate funk, the same full figured fruit, the same balance. One last bottle awaits me in the cellar, but it wont wait long. Who would have thought perfection would be pink.
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text:
Thanks to Exiled for sharing this bottle. 

Bottled 10/17/08.

The beer pours a dark red color with a white head. The aroma is cherry, oak, vanilla, tartness and funk. The flavor is strong cherry with vanilla, oak and tartness. The beer is very dry and is pretty funky. Very drinkable and very well done. Medium mouthfeel and low carbonation.

A decent offering, well worth the money and id possibly get it again. Just didnt knock my socks off. A friend paid a good drop of change for this one, we were excityed to try it, and we were sad tht this was the worst DF beer any of us have had.

very dark red almost purple, nice head. Aroma is very cool rich and funky with a very nice cherry aroma. Great flavour, very sour like a lambec,  with a great charry flavour very with a great cherry tartness that lingers through the finish. Very nice.

Bottle, courtesy of SpencerDB. Pours deep purple, thin pale pink head, no lacing. Nose smells very deep, a mix of berries, blueberries, cherries, raspberries, huckleberries, plus funk, nice cheesy barnyard character, profound aroma, even following directly after the Lou Pepe Kriek. Flavours follow along the same awesome lines: Many layers of berries,  nice tartness and bretty funk. An awesome kriek, everything that kriek should be.

Flaske: Fantastisk udseende. Kirsebærrød med et lille skumhoved. Klar og meget appetitlig. Duften er præget af kirsebær, marcipan og en diskret duft af stald. Smagen er ikke overdreven sur, men balancere med en ordentlig gang bær. Virkelig en treat. Bestemt en af mine favoritter.

Vintage 2008 750ml bottle into tulips, shared with my girlfriend, at The Publican. Celebrating my 29th birthday so why the heck not. 

A - Pours a beautiful dark ruby red color with a pinkish/white colored head which fizzes out quicky leaving a thin cap and some random bubbles here and there. 

S - Tart/sour, lot of cherries, raspberry, funky barnyard, horseblanket. The cherries are so pronounced here, its just wonderful. Sometimes sweet, sometimes tart...always excellent.

T - Very much like the nose, funky, tart cherries, sweet berries. All around, very well done. Outstanding, in fact. This is only going to get better. The funk, cherries, and slight sweetness are perfect. 

M - Light, smooth, refreshing. Slight fizzy carbonation, but doesnt tickle. Dry finish. 

D - We easily finished the bottle and we both wanted more. This is going to be a classic in due time. Stock up now if its near you.

750 ml bottle poured into a champagne flute.  Pours a deep ruby, and is murky with a pink frothy head.  Bubbles shoot up the sides of the glass showing off the big carbonation.  Aroma of cherries, yeasty funk, and oak.  Taste is quite tart, not much sweetness going on at all.  Its very crisply carbonated and has a dry finish.  Complex and interesting, very nice beer.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 Have had quite a few times, finally reviewing a 2008 bottle consumed in 2010.
A: Dark, slightly pinkish red body. Good clarity. Fizzy pink head about a finger or so tall upon pouring. A few lone bunches of lacing left on the sides of the glass.
S: Delicious wild cherries. Light sweetness, but huge sourness emanates from glass. Slightly musty with some wet oak. You can tell the cherries that went into this were top notch.
T: Like the nose the Schaerbeekse cherries are nice and funky. Not much sweetness, but instead a nice tark tartness and sourness. Again, more mustyness and oak.
M: Medium bodied with a good effervescent carbonation that keeps delivering flavor to tongue with each sip. Nice lingering sourness.
O: DrieFonteinens Schaerbeekse Kriek isnt my favorite Kriek (that probably goes to the Cantillon Lou Pepe Kriek), but it is probably the most unique when compared to other krieks and for that it will always have a favored place in my cellar.

head: very tiny 
colour: deep red wine 
smell: clearly natural sent of black cherrys , tarty , bit of sweetness , sour , lambic 
taste: some soft sourness with a very nice bouquet of black cherrys , siny bit of bitterness, and a dry finish , carbonation is soft , waxy aftertaste  
one of the best krieks i had to date

Bottle from Smiths.  Pours turbid deep magenta w great 2f pink head.  Nose is gueuzy funk, tart raspberry, yeasty earthy esters.  Tastes very tart, with earthy cherry, lactic, woody.  Palate is rich, lively, complex, full of krieky goodness.

Medium pop from the cork.  Deep, medicinal red on the glass.  Light fading to nonexistent carbonation.  Cherry, off-sour, rounded oak, and a near plastic fruit in the aroma.  Cherry on fruit sweet but not overly done.  Champagne-like tingle in the finish.  Slight sour reverberations.  Something round and off-center in the taste I cannot place.  Good, really good.  I, however, will spend my hard earned dollars more wisely on a RR -tion or LA amorosa/red poppy which, while a different style, is superior this beer IMHO.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2010 Sampled at the Lambic Summit. Pours a cloudy deep purple with light pink bubbles. Not quite as impressive at the Lou Pepe Kriek. Aroma is quick band-aid followed by horsey funk, oak, cherry pie, baked cherries jubilee.Taste is good, tart, full of cherry pie, a bit sweaty, but has a small touch of medicinal character, and finished with prickly, sour, wild cherries. Palate is light, a bit of cherry candy, and lactic. Very good but will need to revisit. Good thing I have a few bottles. 6/10/2010 9/4/8/4/14=3.9750mL at Spuyten Duyvil. Pours a cloudy deep purple with no head really. Some slight plastic. Salty, quenching sourness. Still a little unilateral on cherry pie. 8/4/8/4/14=3.8

Bottle. Bright red pour with a dark pink head. Slightly cloudy. Smells of fruit and funk, cherry and oak. Not as sweet as you might expect but rather a long drawn out over ripe cherry taste that ends with a subtle tartness.

Opaque ruby with a beautiful pink head. The aroma is loaded with black cherry sour notes, barnyard, horse stable, hay, and farm. The funk profile is nearly flawless. The flavor prevails with funk. Cherry notes are not as evident as the aroma would make it out to seem, but prevalent just the same. Hay, horse pen, and farm animal abound. The palate is slippery , attenuated, and finishes dry and puckeringly. An epic example of the style.

Pour is dark cherry with an aroma bursting with extremely sour cherry.  Huge amounts of funky horse barn.  Almost unparalleled in its funkiness. fills my nose with funky horse nut.  Flavor is out of this world funky.  horse sweat abounds in this fruity but sour brew.  the sour profile takes a back seat to the funk, but the fruit makes its way through.  Not as much cherry as I wouldve liked but exceptional nonetheless

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2010 Pours a dark dark ruby with a head the color of a watermelon Blow Pop. Aroma holds absolutely amazing funk, with horseblanket, stable, hay, and incredible dark cherry characteristics. Flavor is also excellent; awesome funk combining wet wool, hay, and barnyard with a lighter cherry note than what is manifested on the nose. Not quite as good as 3 Fonts Hommage, but still a fantastic lambic. 
---2nd rating 12/2010. April 2010 bottle date; super new. Flavor is a bit less intense than I remember for this version. Still so delectable.

From bottle at Le Cheval Blanc night of the funk.

Appearance : Deep red/pink.

Aroma : Acidic and quite barnyard. Lots of sour cherries.

Taste : Sour cherries, pretty sour and very tart. Very acidic.

Overall : Very fruity and powerful. There is something bothering me on the nose but it seems to fade away with time. The whole beer got better with time. I dont think this is my favourite kriek. I will need to revisit to make sure of that. I was a little bit disapointed by this one. Still good !

750 mL bottle shared at Memphis Taproom on 6/7/10 thanks to Brendan!

Pours crystal clear dark pink, with slight hints of violet.  Fluffy bubbly off-pink head that lasted.  Little lacing, but thick legs were left on the glass as I drank.

Aroma was dominated by cherry, with only the slightest hints of lactic acid/citrus.  Many other krieks are sour lemon with cherry, but this was a beautiful sour cherry aroma, with a ton of dirty funk behind it.

Flavor was a slight sweetness and then truly a sour cherry flavor.  Again, this was now citric tartness, but rather a perfect blend of cherry sourness.  

Medium body with fantastic carbonation highlighting the sourness.  Pretty dry finish.

Overall a beautiful beer that was incredibly balanced and drinkable.
Fluffy clowdy pink foam that quickly goes down to a thin lace. Perfect dry cherry aroma. Sour dry, crisp, fresh taste. The color of raspberry lemonade. Unfortunantly a litle clowdy.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 750 ml bottle (5% ABV). A hazy dark red beer, with a large, frothy/fizzy, mostly diminishing pink/red head. The aroma is lightòy malty (toasted grain), moderately yeasty (barnyard), with notes of cherry, wood, hint of vinegar. The flavor is moderately sweet, heavilty acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation, rather dry and long finish with light bitterness. One of the cases in which I appreciate a thinner mouthfeel and a sweetness/acidity ratio less unbalanced towards the latter. Still pretty sour... Easy 5 on appearence. Unbelievable drinkability (finished the whole 750 ml in a heartbeat) and my favorite Kriek so far. Raising the score from 4.1 to 4.5.

(750ml bottled March 1, 2005 thanks to Walt) cloudy red with off-white bubbles. Nose of sour cherry, funk, wet barrel, and fungi. Taste of unsweet sour cherries, cinammon candy, nice sourness. Not complex, but nice. One of the better fruit lambics, but not nearly at the level of Lou Pepe Kriek. Might be better/sweeter if it was fresh.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2010 Bottle 75cl at home Vintage 2005. This is one murky looking drink! The appearance is a very dark red that only gets darker as you get down to the end of the bottle. The aroma is very funky and is laced with cherry and wood. The taste is in your face cherry with a moderate to high sourness. I would imagine that this will age very nicely as it is doing brilliantly after 5 years in the bottle.

4/30/10.  (Bottled October 17th, 2008).  Rating 1800!  Huge thanks to Tim and Rachel for this awesome wedding gift!  Pours a beautiful dark red with purples in there as well, not much head.  The aroma is lovely sour cherries with juuuuuuust a subtle complex hint of Belgian funk.  The flavor is yummy sour cherries up front and all the way which fades into a nice dryness that makes you really want another sip.  Delish!  Nice high carbonation.  I enjoy that this beer is a lovely sour lambic but still clean and complex
Pours a deep cloudy red with a nice pink head.  Aroma is cherry, earthyness and barnyard.  Taste is tart with a nice sour finish, lots of carbonation.  Vert refreshing.

Pours a very dark ruby red color with a very thin redish pink/off-white head that quickly dissipates without a trace of lacing.

Tart, lactic sour aroma that has a massive amount of sweet dark tart cherries. Theres also some funky earthy oak along with some candy sugar.

Tart, puckering medium body that is pretty sweet and not very acidic. Soft carbonation up front with some slight funk, earthy oak and vanilla. The cherries are very prominent, providing an extremely fresh, sweet juicy fruit flavor which is an excellent balance to the funky tart sourness. Im also picking up a slight nut presence that adds to the earthy character. Dry finish. This beer is very complex, well balanced and insanely drinkable. Highly recommended.

Sample from a bottle shared by Sliffy at DLD 2010. Deep red pour with a medium pinkish head. Funky and tart aroma with sour cherries and a spicy yeast note. Flavor is super tart cherries with that familiar spicy yeast character on the back end.

July 2007 Bottle Date; Sampled March 2010, lightly chilled at approximately 60*F / 15*C.
A soft pour into my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip produces a two finger thick, pink hued, darkly off-white colored head.  The beer is a deep red color with hints of plum and purple to it.  When held up to the light it shows a brilliantly clear bright red hue, and interestingly enough, it shows lots of bubbles that are slowly moving up through this beer, struggling as if this is a viscous brew.  The aroma smells of light urea and sharp lactic acid up front.  This is followed by phenolic, slightly medicinal notes that have a hint of a plastic edge to them, but there is also a funky, musty, moldy quality to the aroma as well.  Tannic cherry skin aromatics as well as some perfume like cherry pulp fruitiness adds to the complexity, but remain subtle compared to the other notes.  As the beer warms, complex cherry aromatics become more noticeable, as does a deeper, rustic, farm-yard funkiness.

Definitely somewhat thick feeling, but not nearly as much as the slowly rising carbonation suggested.  There is a deep, complex, rich, expressive cherry flavor to this beer despite it being quite dry.  The fruit and some phenolic notes mix to suggest a touch of childrens aspirin-like flavors in the finish.  A chewy, flavorful, cherry-skin note adds tannic astringency as well as concentrated cherry notes to the lingering finish.  This has a nice light sourness, at least for this sour-head, as I wouldnt describe it as a hard lambic.  The acidity seems predominantly a smooth mix of fermentation derived lactic acid and acidity from the tart cherries.  I really like the rich, palate coating texture that this has, despite being well carbonated it has a creaminess to it that is quite nice; this is really just such a lush beer that is quite exquisite for numerous reasons.  Lambic funkiness adds light urea notes, musty cob-web flavors and some medicinal notes to the finish.  As the beer warms a floral cherry flavor, as well as a hint of sweetness become more noticeable.

This is a very nice beer that is aging extremely gracefully; the lush texture, incredibly smooth, but ample acidity, rich cherry flavors and stunning visual presentation are among the highlights of this beer.  The aroma could certainly be more complex, especially expressively fruity (but fruit aromatics are so easily lost with age).  It is quite impressive how rich and toothsome that the cherry flavors are despite this beer being quite dry; this really speaks to the quality of the cherries used to make this beer.  Damn, I definitely wish I had a case of these in the cellar; this beer blows the Hommage I just had out of the water by a long-shot.  If I really had to complain I could wish for a bit more acidity and some more Brettanomyces funkiness, but really that is just being greedy.
Sampled at Drie Fonteinen Cafe 2001
This beer uses the same type of cherries as the draft version that I sampled (Schaerbeek), but that is where the similarity ends.  The bottled version is dry, sour and has a bit of cherry in the nose.  It is definitely not sweet and the cherry is not too apparent in the flavor.  The Kriek is the typical deep red color and was quite tasty.  Of course there is the Lambic flavor present to balance and enhance the subtle cherry flavor.

Deep maroon color with a small pink head. The aroma is invigorating with strong notes of the sour yeast, like a Belgian lambic on juice. The cherries come in the flavor, but are still dominated by the tart, or rather they enhance the tartness and flavor. The usual, but smoother, vinegar notes are present. Wow - a delicious sour for the record after all the hype.
Bottled 75cl. Ordered from bierkompasss.de. Very little head. The schaerbeekse cherry components are rather prominent. Complex with a great balance. Without any doubt, a top notch kriek.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2011 Bottle graciously shared by phaleslu DLD weekend.   Pours a slightly hazed pinkish red hue with a medium tiny bubbled offwhite head.   Moderate yogurt lemon tartness.  In the same vain as cantillon Blabaer, the fruit character in this beer is unbelievably clean, fresh, and wonderful.   All the other great funk, oak,  and sour goodness youd expect, but the cherries really do bring this beer to the next level.  Very enjoyable to drink.  No doubts about that.  Great beer.  Thanks again peter for sharing.

750 ml bottle via trade with tytoanderso- thanks again, Tyler!  Pours a deep ruby red color with a small white head with pinkish tints.  Aroma of tart, sour cherries, oak, funk, and yeast.  Flavor is also tart and sour cherries, though not overly sour; notes of wild yeast, oak, and the same funk as in the aroma.  I dont have enough descriptives for this style.  Medium-bodied, with nice carbonation.  Really great fruit lambic, and I need to get a hold of more good ones in the style.

Aroma - pulled out the cork and the first whiff was the stomach acid/like-cheesy aroma.  Poured into my glass, its funky, cherries, vinegar, and cheese.

Appearance - hazy pink body and a airy off-white/pinkish head.  

Taste - biting sourness, clean cherry flavor, wood, lemons, funky cheese, stomach acid...wonderful.

Palate - not nearly as mouth stripping that some lambic/gueuze can be, but its powerful none the less.

Overall - this beer really lets the cherry flavor shine, without being a candy mess that most cherry beers tend to be.  No sweetness, lots of cherry flavor but along with that ride is all the classic goodness of a lambic.  Wonderful and I wish this was sold in cans.  Love it.

courtesy of degarth during the Whole Foods / CCB Cask Event.
pours reddish, thin white head.
aroma and flavors, lots of cherry goodness with vinegary effervescent mouthfeel. There is enough fruits to make the sour/acidic palate forgettable and turn this into an amazing tasting experience. 
Really nice lambic but not my favorite by 3 Fonteinen.

Bottle at Eulogy.  Pours a gorgeous crimson and garnet with just hints of a creamy pink head on it.  Beautiful light funk and barnyard, soft spring cherries, touches of balsamic vinegar. Big sour cherry, tangy and tart, gentle tingly acid.  A nice back and forth between subtle tartness and bold cherry.  Slow and long tart acid on the finish over some faintly smoky wood, with some earthy tannic notes on the dregs.  This was delicious.
Wet wooden aroma with a hint of citron. Fruity flavor but not sweet with a washout effect. Really good oude kriek

Bottle courtesy of Degarth.  A hazy red beer with a tall, fizzy, pink head.  Nose is cherry also lots of earthy wood notes and light spice.   Medium body with lively carbonation and an oily texture.  Fairly sweet and acidic, flavor is lots of sour cherry and cherry pit up front, earthy oak notes are present, light funk, lemon zest, vanilla, and almond paste notes are found throughout.  Very vinous, there is a good amount of acidity and sourness here but I dont find it overly aggressive the sweetness of the cherry does a good job balancing it out.  Dry tart finish.

750ml bottle.  Pours a nice mostly clear pinkish purple with a small off pink ring.  Nose held some semi tart cherry notes along with hints of dry oak.  Palate was a little underwhelming, was hoping it was a little more sour.  A pretty tasty Kriek none the less.
Dark ruby pour. Aroma is of wild cherry and woody notes, flavor follows. Nice sour, tart lambic not too overly acetic. Couldnt ask any more of a kriek.

Pours swampy pinkish red with a thin head. Aroma- cheese, old wet wood. Taste- deep, rich  cherry pie filling, but not sweet at all. Cinnamon, basement funkiness and a ton of cherries. Like a funky, sour cherry pie. Wow.

Deep ruby red pour with a thin white head.  Lots and lots of sour cherry aroma.  Touch of smoke and general funk.  Sour cherry flavor.  Cherry flavor is very prominant and stands out above the sourness.  Slightly bitter and tannic.  Nice pure cherry taste and flavor with good enjoyable sourness.

750mL bottled October 17th 2008.  Pours a pinkish cloudy ruby red with a pinkish head.  Smells awesome, like sour cherries, funk, and a bit of cheese.  Tastes like tart funky cherries, fading smoothly and cleanly into a bitter cherry peel finish that coats the mouth nicely.  More bitter and funky than Lou Pepe, with a little less tartness.

Silky came outta nowhere to offer up this badboy at Woodshop 5.0.  I wish Id have sampled it earlier to really get the subtleties of this one, because even late in the game it was lovely.  Nicely subtle and sweet.  Vinegar to funk and leather.  Tart and lightly fruity.  Smooth on all of the above.  Murky swampwater looking thing though.  Really good beer.
bottle - cherry red beer with no foam. Aroma is fruity and sour, no hops. Flavour is sour, but not extreme like other lambics. Nice fruit hints. Medium to low carbonation.

[bottle from bierkompass.de, 5% abv]
Sour cherry nose that is not vinegary but has some herbal quality. Hazy maroon appearance with only some white wisps on top. Complex flavour of sour cherry (not crazy sour, though) and herbs, notes of clove and white grape. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, tingly sweet and sour finish.

A: The pour is a deep, dark blood red color with some tiny carbonation bubbles emanating from the center of the glass.

S: A great sour cherry aroma along with some wonderful oak notes. The funk has a nice mustiness and even a bit of the popular horse blanket.

T: Again, the cherries are the star. There is also a nice dryness from the oak and (presumably) from the cherry skins. The sourness is not as intense as usual for a lambic, but the wet blanket funk is very noticeable.

M: A nice medium body (on the full side for a lambic, actually) with a moderate level of carbonation.

D: Im glad to have finally been able to give this lambic a try. Great cherry and funk to this one, and Id drink it again any day.

2008 bottle.  Pours deep ruby red with thin white head, aroma is horse blanket/barnyard, cherries, and acid funk.  Taste is all tart cherries, some wood, and huge tart funkiness.  Excellent brew, wish I could have it more often!
bomba! il mijore kriek mai bevuto! vintage 2006 37.5 cl... ha un equilibrio olfattivo e al palto strepitoso.. pervade la bocca di un acidità fruttata dove le note di ciliegia esplodono!!

Bottle at Pauls: Murky ruby color with a pinkish head. The aroma is very corky and leathery. Has that great house funk all their offerings have. Theres also a soft acidic cherry note. Slick and acidic body. Crisp citric and lactic acidity. The funk is there as well to accompany the low pH with a note of cork and of course that funky leathery character. Another awesome Fruit-Lambic from these guys. Complex.

750ml bottle courtesy of RCL. Thanks. Pours a cloudy dark red color with a small pink head that soon dissipates. The aroma is strong and overtly funky with brett, horse blanket and sour fruits. The flavor is heavily sour with tart cherries, cherry pit and oak. The palate is full and silky smooth. The finish is long with lingering oak and cherries. Overall: A first rate kriek, I absolutely loved it.

750ml bottle vintage 2008 from K&L generously shared by alfrantzell on BA. Thanks a lot, Arne! This is one of the more difficult names to spell, as evidenced by the fact that its spelled differently on BA vs. RB. Both sites do agree, however, that its a damn fine beer, and I also agree with this assessment.  Pours a deep, clear crimson color with a decent pink head that bubbles away fairly quickly.  Aroma is loads of tart cherries, oak, and funkiness, including my favorite aroma: horseblanket. Its like they took an old blanket off the dirtiest, sweatiest horse in the barn and threw it right into the fermenter. I love it.  Flavor is also really awesome and heavy on the cherry. Somewhat sour with brett and lacto/pedio. Very earthy and oaky. More funky horseblanket and definite hints of other cloths used to cover various livestock and zoo creatures, whatever those may be.  Dry, acidic, and lively on the palate. Medium body. Exactly to style on the mouthfeel.  Drinkability is good but not quite outstanding. Overall though, this beer is outstanding. Easily one of the better fruit lambics out there.

2004 vintage.

Ruby red with pink hues. A small pink head that disappears quickly. Small lacings.

Funky notes of aged cheese, dusty cellar and mold in the nose. Pleasant rich cherry notes balance the funk. Some acidity. A hint of wood.

The flavor is tart with interesting and pleasant notes of sour cherries. A salty funky note of cheese and horse blanket. Faint residual sweetness. Notes of lemon, wood and grass. The finish is dry with a mild grassy bitterness and hints of minerals and lingering cherry aromas.

Medium body with pleasant carbonation and a not overly dry finish.

A very good fruit lambik with an interesting cherry character. Impressive.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2010 2005 Bottle thanks to jrob21!Bright red with a moderate pink head. Nose has little cherry left, mainly brett funk in heavy citrus, leather, and light hay. Incredibly balanced, creamy flavor has more cherry and less leather, still lightly puckering citrus, and also some chocolate, nut, bread, and an odd, old meat note in the finish. A little thin but still nicely carbonated. The flavor on this is still damn good, but Im increasingly of the opinion that fruit lambics are better when younger.
Pours a pinkish reddish color. Aromas of cherries, almonds. Flavor is a subdued tart cherry taste, not a big as I expected. Medium bodied with a slight tart mouthfeel. This is a great beer.

Bottle. Dark red colour with a creamy, pink head. Aroma is very fresh and fruity with a lot of cherries, some mustiness and quite a bit of acidity. Taste is not so sour, but fruity, round and almost a bit buttery. Some vanilla in the finish. Very good and very special, but maybe a bit too mild to be the best in the world.

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml) Deep ruby red with a light pink head. Aroma is heavy amounts of sour and funk, barnyard notes, and some very mild wood hints. Lots of sour cherries as well. Flavor is really sour, but not a whole lot of cherries present. A lot of tart and sour funk with a lot of earthy and dry flavors. Some wooden hints near the end with a very tart and lingering finish. Outstanding. Rating #2100.

Beautifully deep cherry looks with a baby pink foam. Rubber and sour apple tree on the nose then plenty of farmyard cowshit.  Amazing sherbert and cherry tartness. A childish carbonation makes it very vibrant and cheeky. Long and woody in the finish with an almost mulled wine spice and orangeness. Boom.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2009 Botle, 75 cl, alone :-) Dark red colour of cherries, starting with a little pink head disappearing fast, but although still a very decent presentation. The aroma is first light sour, but with cherries later on, making this beer have a good smell. The taste is "WOOW!" or "fantastic". If you really want to drink a real Kriek, than you have to drink this one. You taste really good the Schaerbeekse Krieken, but not sweet at all, and although there is lambic in it, also not sour at all. Very enjoyable beer to drink. It may cost 9 EUR per bottle, but it is certainly worth it, the champagne between the (Oude) Krieken-beers!

Bottled at 3rd Brugs BF, as Oude Kriek. Light hazy deep red/burgundy colour, pink head. Aroma of cherry pits, funk, sourness, some wood. Flavour is sour, very sour with some cherries. Nothing more. Light to medium bodied. Not my style of beer.

Hazy red pour, thin quickly fading head. Bizarre aroma. Cherries, yes, but also hints of rubbing alcohol. wood, cinnamon, and lemon. It calms down a little with time, but still strange. A decently potent acidity first hits the tongue, followed by a drawn out cherry finish. Also a bit of wood, and perhaps smoke in the finish. A nice, subtle touch at the end. Ultimately good, but not entirely my style.

strong aroma of cherries, flavor is crisp and light, along with a a whispy palate. No sugarry sweetness- tastes natural. Kind og like a cherry vitamin water, but better. Bottle from Ryan Blanksis Sourfest- Hollywood, Florida.

Red pour.  Pink head.  Wow this one smells really nice.  Cherries leap out of the glass followed by some lemon zest, vinegar, wood, but mostly dominated by tart cherries.  Flavor is wonderfully tart and remarkable fruity.  Really a wonderful beer.  Damn good.

[Bottle] shared by timbeer for my birthday. Thanks! Once the cork comes out, the bubbles build and slowly creep toward the mouth of the bottle. Pours a lightly hazy deep ruby with a small, effervescent head that is just the faintest shade of pink. The aroma has lots of the typical 3F funky brettanomyces character, surprisingly subtle and well blended cherry, and obvious lactic and subtle acetic character. The first sip sends waves of puckering acidity rolling through my mouth that lingers for some time after swallowing. Once my palate gets used to the onslaught, the admittedly faded cherry flavor is apparent. The funk is definitely there, but this beer is just straight up sour cherries and intense acidity. Really, really great beer. It would be interesting to see what another 3 years does to it.

uge thanks to Koopa for sending this my way, thank you so much I included it as part of a larger sour tasting. Reddish-pink color and different than the Hommage. Smells like cherry lambic but not as fruity as I hoped. Then again, this was bottled in March of 2005 so that could be a factor. The taste was spritzy cherries that reminded me of cherry 7-Up! This was a good enough kriek but nowhere close the Hommage.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-22-2009 02:04:21

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2011 Bottle 2004 at Akkurat, shared with Andreassen11 and plovmand. 
Pours hazy red with a brownish glow and a red/brown head. 
It has a very dry and nice sweet unripe sour cherry aroma, thats a little perfumed. 
Flavour is dry with notes of sour cherries, almonds, wood and grass. 
It has a smooth but dim after taste of fermented sour cherries. 
9-5-8-4-17=4,3 
Re-rate: Bottle 2010 shared at plovmand tasting. 
This is the first time I have thought a lambic tasted better fresh than with  some years on its back. 
Pours reddish with a pink head. 
Nice and very smooth typically 3 Fonteinen aroma and flavours combined with great dry and semi sour cherry aromas and taste. 
In this young bottle the fermented notes was non-existent, which makes it absolutely fantastic compared to the old bottle. 
This is without doubt the best Oude Kriek.

2004 bottle at Akkurat. Hazy red with a staying light pinkish head. Fantastic aroma of cherries, oak, light acid and almonds. The flavour is sour cherries, oak, almond and dried fruit. Creamy and smooth texture. This is by far one of the best sours Ive ever had.

750ml bottle, dated 01march2005, with a big thanks to PhillyBeer2112!  Pours a mostly clear reddish pink with a moderate pinkish white head that lingers.  Aroma is just enough funk to be interesting, with sour cherry and oak mixed in nicely.  Flavor is lovely as well, with more bright sour cherry, light funk and oak.  Great balance of funk and tart with a nice dry finish.  Wow, this is a tasty one and a nice way to move past that nasty Papier.  Thanks mucho Dan!

Bottle @ WTF OMG! This was my last pour of the night, so Im a bit hazy on this one.  Poured a murky red. Nose was sour cherries. Flavor was sour fruit, sweet cherry mixed with young cherries. Very very tart. Awesome kriek. Finished dry and woody.
Beautiful hazy red with a thick pink head. Aroma is strong woody and sour cherries. Not that elegant as other kriek I had. Flavour starts sour toward a mellow lingering cherry taste.

Bottle shared amongst friends. Beautiful ruby pour with a nice pinkish white head. Aroma is super jammy and up front, and much more present than in the Hommage. Flavor is more subtle with some nice tartness, sour cherries, and clean acidity. Super clean finish that was perfectly sour. This was fantastic.

Very deep red colour with a small off-white head. Unknown age of this old bottle with the old label.. Aroma is real cherries, none of that candy like crap and its mixed with a good dose of funk, cheesy and sweaty. Flavour is similar with very deep fruit flavour and real wood mixed up with lovely funky stuff. Tastes like eating bugs that are eating cherries. Lovely and in nice balance.

Nonostante non abbia una particolare predilezione verso le lambic,ogni tanto mi permetto di assaggiarne qualcuna e questa di 3 Fonteinen non mi è spiaciuta affatto,anzi.
Colore rosso vivo con una schiuma spessa e persistente.Laroma delicatissimo di pura ciliegia.In bocca è frizzante e secca e un pochino acida ma molto ben bilanciata.Deliziosa e godibilissima!

Tangy, pure, fresh cherries. Wow. Absolutely ruby. Glowing. Fantastic. Pours a murky dark rose-red, with pink fringes and a lightly-tinted pink-white head.  Flavor is tangy and fluffy. Very tart and citric acid. A light bit of sweetness works well with the bright, flashy fruit. The fruit has really sunk into the lambic funk. Super cottony. Pours a dark red with a 2 finger reddish white head. Sour funk aroma with a cherry background.  Tart and nice balance of fruit and funk.  Awesome.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - bottling date 26/02/2007 - at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-06-13) Dark red and hazy. Small pink head. Sourness, cherris and cherry stones in aroma. Medium bodied and dry palate wiht medium carbonation. Sourness, cherries, wood, fruitiness, cherry stones, light bitterness and fruitiness in taste. Cherries and sourness in aftertaste.

Bottle. Well.. kriek just doesnt get much better than this. Theres a cartload of funk to pair with the amazing cherries in this beer. To me, this epitomizes kriek. Tastes just like the countryside. Brilliant.

Bottle at WSF. Deep magenta with pink head. Medicinal in both the nose and the body, but not in a sharp or offensive way. A tad metallic. Has a bit of vinegar spike but then mellows out. Has some candy notes and then tannic ones too. Marachino type cherry flavors. Ends up being very nice

2005 bottle April 2008, thanks to Dedollewaitor. Misplaced the notes for a good year...

Deep red with a pink head. Sour fresh cherry aroma with almond, vanilla and wood. Flavour is sweetish cherry, with lots of wood, and a wonderful tart cherry aftertaste. Delicious!

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2009 pours a pinkish color with a thin white head. a surprising amount of spotty lacing is left behind. 

plastic band-aid nose with notes of earth, herbaceous funky stink and tart fruit. 

that plastic aroma carries over in to the flavor... its met with a savory almost woody note, tannic dryness from the cherries, a touch of tartness, wheat-like mustiness, spice and some stank. 

average body with prickly sharp carbonation... meh, ill have to revisit sometime. thanks jason for the taste! 6/4/6/3/14/3.3


bottle from rustychiles...

looks like cloudy cherry juice mixed with beer...

big difference...smells of wheat, rubber, minerals, cinnamon, tart cherry, red wine vinegar, bubble gum and rose petals.

the palate is incredibly tart and dry with notes of tart cherry, cinnamon, flowers and a dry yummy herbaceous finish.

the medium body is clean, dry and prickly. much better... 8/5/8/4/17/4.2

Tasted last saterday @ Eizeringen
day of the kriek.
Hazy red color, with a pinkisch head.
Aroma sour, cherry. 
Medium body.
Taste refrshing, good cherry, sourness,
and dry ending.
GOOD.

Hazy raspberry pour with small ivory bubbles that line the outside of the glass.  Quite dry with an overwhelming band-aid flavor that has hint of tart cherry skin, and a bit of acidity.  Medicinal nose.  A little funky, a little sour, quite average.  Disappointed.

Bottle shared by BOLTZ7555 at hellbillys holiday tasting.  Pours a hazy maroon color with a small pink head.  Flavor and aroma of tart, unripe berries, cherries, lemon and a touch of aspirin.  A bit of funk and a dry finish.  Delicious.  Thanks Jason.

Hazy reddish beer, pink head, sour cherry aroma, very acidic, earthy and dry cherry taste. I liked the Oud beersel kriek a bit more than this and found them quite comparable, the high carbonation in this suprised me. Not really vinous but really refreshing on a nice summer day. All in all a really good kriek.

750ml bottle shared by BOLTZ7555 at hellbillys holiday tasting.  Pours milky cranberry red with a thin off-white head.  The nose is light barnyard, bandaids and tart fruit.  The taste is unripe fruit, vinegar and light barnyard funk.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  Good  refreshing brew.  Thanks Jason!

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2009 bottle.  Pours magenta with an off-white head which dissipated quickly.  Nose of vinegar and sour cherries.  Taste is sweet, sour cherries and funk.  Mouthfeel is nicely sour.  Very good brew.

A hugh sour cherry and aroma a bit like old black cherry something.A dark cherry with a hint of pink. Hugh sour cherry acidic, very dry finish. Medium carbonation with a very solid mouthfeel and body. A very nice beer.

Thanks to decaturstevo for this one.
Deep cherry colored body with a full sized fleeting pink head.
Leathery sweaty aroma over musty cherries.
Tart, sour, acidic. 
I would prefer thsi one with food, rather than just by itself as a drink.

From a bottle courtesy of friends.  Dark pink, fizzy body with creamy pink head.  Aroma dry with oak and cherries.  First thing that hit me when I took a drink was a saltiness to it, then the cherry flavor, with a type of tobacco flavor finish.  Maybe would be good in a cigar bar!  Interesting to say the least, but good.

Thanks to rustychiles for the supercheap bottle. Pours a dark pink with thin white head. Aroma is cheesy, funky, with lots of acetic sour quality. Very faint, late cherry aroma. Taste is quite sour/acetic like a gueze. Not much fruit character at all. Cheesy, funky, super sour, with some hints of cherry in the aftertaste that are a bit soapy. Decent, but Ive had better.

Excellent! Many thanks to jrob21 for the bottle.  Cloudy deep reddish brown color pinkish head.  Packed full of juicy red cherries, tart, oak, funkiness, and slightly musty.  Complex, fairly easy to drink, and quite sour.  I am really enjoying this one.

Bottle at tasting.  Pours red with a small white head.  Aroma of tart cherry, acetic, wood.  Taste is very tart, with lots of cherry, little funk, and some oak.  Finish is very sour and lingering.  Body is pretty well carbonated and very tart.  Overall, a nice tart lambic.
2007 rossa schiuma buona poco persistent note fruttate vinose ciliwgia sotto bosco acidula legno lieve nocciola in bocca molto viniosa fruttata buona acidita un poco tannica

THANK YOU to dra19 for breaking into this at the tasting.  Ive been looking at it on his shelf for a while, and he mustve been drunk enough to say go ahead.  Nice bright pour, with a puckering sour smell.  The cherry flavor isnt enough to overpower the sourness of it, like some lambics, which adds even more to the overall beer.  Alcohol is a little high for a lambic, but you cant really tell while drinking it.  Very very nice.
750ml bottle. Had at a beer tasting. Bright red in color with a light pink head. Taste of sour cherries. A tart aftertaste.

Clear and very bright red in colour with a large fairly quick to dissipate pink head, good lacing.  The aroma is very tart and acidic, lots of dark cherries, pretty sour.  The flavour is pretty sharp, lots of black cherries, tart and very sour with a underlying sweetness.  Acidic mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes very long, sour and highly acidic.
Another outstanding lambic from 3 Fonteinen.  They all seem to have a wonderful balance for such a powerful lambic.
750ml bottle obtained in a trade with Engelsmann, thanks Martin.
Opened on July 12, 2008.
Bottled on April 5,2004.

2005 bottle: Pours a very red brown with a small white head. Very strange aroma. Super tart with a few sweet cherries and wet wood smells. What a unique flavor. A little spritzy with a light sweetness and a sour tartness that dominates the flavor and puckers the mouth. Sweet cherries fill in the body a little, but the dry wood and tart citrus make up the  majority of the flavor.

2005 Bottle. Pours red with thin off white head. Aroma is tart, funky wild yeast, the cherries are hidden in the background. Flavor starts with a very funky sweetness and finishes with a good cherry flavor. Its amazing how diverse beers can be. Mouthfeel is good. Im liking this more and more as I drink it.

Served from a 750 ml caged and corked bottle at Coopers Seafood in Scranton, Pa. The beer poured a nice redish color with a medium thickness pink head and good retention and lacing. The aroma is of sweet cherries but also a nice kick of barnyard funk. The taste is very tart and strong cherry taste along with the funk but the funk is not overpowering. A very enjoyable taste as if the cherries were freshly picked. This ranks right up there with any Cantillon offerings.
My favorite Kriek.  Ruby with small publish head.  Tart.  Cherries of course.  Sour.  Wood and must.  A good one.
2005 - Bottle thanks to travita. Deep ruby in color and cloudy with a small white head. Aroma is tart with cherries and funk. Taste is sweet cherries followed by a zap of tartness and a dry finish.

Bottle.  Pours a reddish purple with a minimal violet head.  Aroma of brett, cherries, wood, and some funk.  Taste is similar, but wasnt quite as sour as the nose.  Lots of cherries, dark fruits, wine, and spice, with consistent sour present.  Fairly light body with medium carbonation.  Very nice beer with a lot of complexity, but lacking the strong sour taste i associate with a lambic.

Bouteille verte, avec bouchon de liège, de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez MartinT. Arôme: Légère odeur de cerises vinaigrées. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de vinaigre aux cerises fruités. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement vinaigré. (Rating #2201)

bottle thanks to travita!!  congrats on 1000.  poured a purplish with a violet head.  aroma of cherry and a number of other aromas i was not able to pick out.  flavor was a little tart with some cherries.  light body and fizzy.  thanks for the great brew travita.

1000th rating!!!  2005 vintage.  The smell is cherry, oak, wood, tart, good complexity, horsey, and barnyard.  The look is very red, cannot see through, no head.  The taste is very dry, cherry flavor, sour, wood, and funky.

Bottle thanks to Travita. Pours a deep purple mixed with a little brown, light violet head. Aroma is great, sour grape, some brett, sour. Flavor is farmhouse, sour grape, very good. Mouthfeel is light-medium body, fizzy carbonation. Overall, Good stuff!
05 bottle thanks to travita, dirty reddish amber color with circle of bubbles, aromas of sweet and sour and woody cherry, flavors of dry cherries, tart and dry finish

2005 Bottle thanks to Travita. Pours with a small white head that fades over a muddy purple body. Aroma has shifted away from the fruits with age. Lots of nice barnyard funk, cheesy with very light cherry notes. A bit acidic with leather as well. Kind of burns my nose a bit. Taste is funky and acidic, but no where near as sour as I was expecting (this was after drinking a 2006 La Folie thanks to Lumpy). Lively bubbles and a dry mouthfeel.
#900 2005 bottle thanks to Travita.  purple pour with a pink head. great nose of cherries and funk.  great on the palate with a sweet cherry flavor that finishes with wood and funk.

2007 bottle courtesy of gunhaver. Pours a bright red cherry color with a thin white head. Aroma is sour and sweet with notes of cherry, vinegar, wood, mustiness, and funk. Flavor is sweet and tart with notes of ripe fruit, cherries, vinegary acidity, and some faint vanilla or spice notes. Generally medium body with a tart fruit finish.

Bottle, courtesy Retorp. Pours a cloudy hazy reddish apple, very very creamy head and lacing. Nose of tart cherries, some oak, caramel notes, and some mint. Flavors has tons of smooth tart notes, cherry, some raspberry, some unique sweetness in the finish. Very smooth and crisp body. Flavor lacks the huge tart edge that the nose has, but who cares, this beer is awesome.

07 Vintage.  Thanks group for the share. Pours cherry red with nose of funk, clorox, and sour cherry. Flavor is sour cherry, sharp acidity, and vinegary tartness.  Finishes dry with a vinegar tartness.

2006 vintage.

Pours a nice red with a small pink head. Aroma is sour, cherry, musty, funky. Flavor is sour cherries, oak, a little sourness, there is  a slightly medicinal cherry flavor in this one that I didnt care for but all in all this was a pretty tasty lambic.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2009 My 100th Belgian rating.  75cl Bottle from March 2006 almost 3 years old.  Pours glowing unclear ruby red with a small super fine white/pinkish froth.  Tart cherry aroma, very acidic, leather, dusty, pool water, actually each note is quite subtle.  Great mouthful, unbelievably fine and sharp, tiny fizzy carbonation, medium body delivers flavors perfectly, really satisfies the palate, slightly syrupy in the finish.  Really nice super tart cherry flavor, more tart than straight out acidic, nice juicy punch on the way down, really sour, lots of citric acid.

750 ml bottle ( March 06).  Pours a clear reddish color with a small pink head.  The aroma is sour cherries, other berry notes, and oak.  The flavor is much of the same: sour cherries, oak, tart, dry, some sweetness develops.  This was very good, although not what I expected.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 Intense bright red, slightly hazy with slight white head.  Aroma of musty cherries.  Nicely sour throughout, with wet blanket finish.  Nicely complex, a real winner.
Bottle, shared with Bastien, Arne, Cameron, courtesy of Armand and his wife.  Delicious, top notch, cant say enough.

750 ml bottle bought somewhere. Pours a very nice cloudy red/pink color with a small bubbly pink head. The aroma is sour, some cherries, and lots of wood. The taste is very nice, slightly sour, lots of woody flavors, and a bit of sour cherries. Very nice. Sweetens as it warms and you get used to it. Very nice.

Winter Welcome Toronto.
Aroma is funky, barnyard, mixed fruit, hazy burgundy, tiny pink head. Flavour is a fruit burst, with funky undertones and the usual wet blanket, farm like goodies too. Full bodied, way too easy to consume. Majestic. Thank You Sammy.

Bottle, 5%. Made with 60% Schaerbeekse cherries. Litterally mouthwatering acidic aroma. Some fresh cellar aroma and a hint of fat cherries. Quite cloudy, but beautiful deep red colour, very small pink head. The flavour is also nicely acidic and on the sweet side. Some fruit, but it reminds me mostly of saftevand. Very high carbonation. Very good, even though I prefer the sharper edge of Cantillon. 9 4 8 3 16

2006 Bottle from Sam’s Clybourn. Pours a deep ruby with a tinge of brown. Nose is acidic and woody, not a ton of funk. Taste is pretty acidic and distinctly cherry flavored. Bitter finish and could probably use a few more years. Finishes dry and clean. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2009 Bottle 750ml, 
Appearance: amber ruby red , mid haze (white top tea like).Aroma: sour cherry feel, hint of vanilla, slightly woody with funky farm feel. Brown malts beneath. Flavour/Palate: strong sourness, baking soda , vanilla with tartness around. A bit harsh, rough sample of style.

Sampled during Minnesota first annual Sourfest and shared by several guests. Pours a hazy reddish amber brew with a thin pinkish white head that quickly dissipates to a fine film. Aroma of tart cherries, powdered and toasted malt, some barnyard funk, and a touch of oak. Taste is slightly sweet than tart with some carbonation and medium bodied texture. Flavors include semi-sweet cherries, a touch of yeast and golden grain malt, Finish is semi-sweet with a mild cherry and yeast aftertaste.

Pours dark hazy red with a short lived pink head.  Aromas of horseblanket, cobwebs, cherries, and general funkiness.  Flavor of extremely smooth funkiness, slight tart but not too sour, some cinnamon and a wonderful buttery cherry flavor. Smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation.  Probably the best lambic Ive personally had to date.

2005 vintage:  poured deep red with maroon around the fringes and a nice pink head.  aroma was lots of cherry with oak and citrus, and a slight vinegar note.  flavor was much of the same lots of citrus and oak with the cherries.  nice sourness with tannins supplying a well rounded character.  nicely carbonated with plenty of tannins to provide structure, rather full feeling in the mouth.  excellent.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Huge thanks to Joris for this one of the last few Beers i need to complete the 250rating Top50 ... in a bottle labeled in Tipex  ... red brown ... light woody ... lots of cherry in nose also agree with barnyard comment  ... light but lots of depth ... slight sweetness and a lots of tartness but huge cherry tones .


Bottle at chrisO... Light hazy red.. Thin pink lacing... Bih funky fruit.. Soft dusty musty fruits nose... Tart... Sharp fruits.. Musty fruits... Big Cherry fruit
nice pinkish cherry color, little foam nose is cherry, uhhm some tart lambic barnyard smells. but yum, flavor is refreshing lotsa odd lambic notes with a great cherry flavor that saturates the beer

Bottled sample shared with oakbluff. Deep ruby red in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas of ripe sour cherry, mild wood, and a touch of funk. Great flavors of sour (but not overly so) cherries, mud, wood, farmhouse funk, light malts, and a bit of lemon. Not as crazy sour as Cantillon products, but everything is so well balanced. Very nice indeed.

Bottle shared via piscator- thanks Kris for this tasty treat!  Pours a rich dark cherry colour with pinkish head. Nose- charry forward with some wood. Taste- full mouthfeel with fresh plump tasting cherries, medium tartness earthy brett. The wood and cherry tartness mingle well to create a highly drinkable fruit lambic. Finishes with a soft lemony sourness.  Lovely drink

murky dark purple under a small pink head.  woody, brett, cherry, fruit aroma.  flavor is very woody with cherry and brett.  tart.  mellow.  smooth.  not as acidic as the regular kriek.  full body.  good.

75 cL bottle, huge thanks to Hildigöltur. Pours clear and golden red with a fizzy pink head. Tart cherry deep spiced to mild dry almond aroma. Dry wooden and cherry almondish towards mild spiced initial flavoured. Dry cherry flavoured as main impression and a smooth and slight sulphorish note in addition. Acidic and tart finish with a nice cherry fruity accent.

Bottle (01 march/ 2005) from Marcus. Very much appreciated. Pours a very dark reddish tinged brown with an emphemeral pinkish tan head. Aroma of sour cherry and brett. Medium body with fizzy/creamy carbonation. Flavor is sour, brettish, and puckering cherry. Finish is smooth, sour and a bit earthy. Not like sucking cherry pits. More like sucking sour cherry skins. Takes a long time for wood and oak to be noticeable, but it does happen. They don’t make many like this. It just gets better with time.

text: 750 ml bottle dated 22 March 2006.  Lambic is probably the style I have the most problem with in terms of understanding and appreciating the beer.  Some are just way too sour and acidic for me and I dont understand the attraction.  Ive recently read more about the process of making lambics to try a gain a better understanding of this style and appreciate the subtleties.  In short, this beer was an utter gem.  Pours an absolutely gorgeous rose/plum color with a moderate, fizzy pink head that disappeared after a few sips.  The body starts out cloudy but is fairly clear towards the end of the glass.  The aroma is mostly sour with some cherry notes picked up as well.  No oak detected.  The flavor of this beer simply amazed me.  Sour up front, but not mouth puckering, followed by tart cherries, some light oak, and yeast.  No single component overwhelms any of the other characteristics.  Very effervescent and lively on the tongue.  I shared this bottle with my wife, and she is not into sour flavors at all, and she was equally effusive about this beer.  Really, really good.

750 ml bottle consumed on 6/5/08.  Ive been holding onto this one for quite awhile.  A warm spring evening playing horseshoes seemed like the perfect opportunity to open this kriek.  Pours reddish pink with a pink soapy head that lingers.  The nose is phenomenal.  Sour fruit everywhere.  Lots of tart cherries and raspberries.  Acidic fruit thats almost gueze like. Acidic and vinegary cherry flavors with cherry skins.  There is a slight barnyard character with earthy herbal notes that come out more as it warms up.  The slightly sweet cherries, lactic tartness, and earthiness all balance out each other really well.  Excellent lambic I could drink more of.

Bottle enjoyed with dessert at Heeren van Liedekerke, Belgium (3/2008); unsure of the vintage.  Smells of vinegar and cherry skins, showing the acidity and the fleshiness of the cherries.  Immediately after the first sip, theres a charge of bretty, guezue-like sourness that cuts through the foamy carbonation.  The charge subsides just as quickly, to be replaced by a full cherry flavor that is wonderful and puts many other krieks to shame.  The cherry lingers into the finish and provides the baseline with which the other flavors interact:  a dry yeasty bitter on top of the tongue and on the sides in the beginning, followed by soft lactic sweetness.  Dark yeasty things play around throughout, and are a wonderful complement to the main event: the perfect balance between ripe cherry fruitiness and the guezue-sour juiciness.  Clear ruby red in the glass, pink fizzy head medium to small, but lasting.  Wonderful beer.

My bottle is one of the newer labels, or maybe just the American distributors label, but whatever the cause, I simply love this label design.  Oh yeah, the beer inside is fantastic too.  The head begins the beer on a plain note - a simple layer of coral pink.  But from this unassuming gaseous crust comes a tart and tangy vapor, stemming even deeper into the pomegranate seed, crimson core.  One deep pull into my olfactory and my teeth begin to chatter with a mix of anticipation and fear of the sweet and tart beer to come.  Vinegar, simple and sweet, takes control of my nose, with a side of dry gauze and leather.  Simple enough.  It is then time to taste, where I am immediately crestfallen by its blandness.  A few seconds pass, though, and the beer is reclaimed in the name of good brew with its skillfully composed aftertaste.  It begins with a moderate tartness, followed by a slightly more intense tongue scraping astringency, before the storm smoothes over and reveals a glowing but subtle note of dark cherries.  Simple, but effective.  A bit of warmth does wonders too, giving that initial tart a little more depth and a little less screech, and makes the luscious cherry touch even more luscious.  Almost impossible, I say, but its done.  A fantastic drink at higher degrees of thermal investment.

bottled 22 march 2006, consumed 04 may 2008.  pours a deep nearly opaque burgundy, with a smallish pink head that sticks around better than ive ever seen on a lambic.  initial aromas are almost gueze-like, with sharp lemon and orange zest playing with traces of barnyard.  but theres a distinct yet subtle dark cherry note there which, when combined with the yeast and malt effects, give it a very vinous nose.  the cherries come out a lot more in the taste, for great effect.  as you acclimate to the puckering sour and wild yeast by-products, it has a great dark, sour cherry flavor that reminds me of childhood contests to see who could spit the pit the farthest.  all the usual actors are there, the funky citrus zest, a light woody note, and hints of malt, but the cherries dominate.  its great:  theyre not overwhelming in their sharpness, but they stand out just for how great they taste.  long, sour, dry finish (i love how these beers have an excellent fruit flavor without the accompanying sweetness), smooth as silk, and a surprising amount of bubbles.  light-medium body.  absolutely superb!  best kriek ive tried.  possibly the best lambic ive had.  immense complexity, divine flavor, supremely drinkable; i cant find any flaws.

Bottled 22 March 2006.  Pours electric red with a thin pink-white skirting of foam.  Aroma offers a  tart but somewhat mild cherry presence, which provides a pleasant glaze for a body full of stinky, cheesy yeasts, balsamic vinaigrette, cobwebs, basement air, and airy raspberry fruitiness.  Late warmth of cinnamon and apples.  Flavor is juicy and warm and vibrant; softly funky, bearing an imposing but never overbearing figure, full of character.  A vast wash of sour and pungent fruit characer; unripened mango, sour cherry, orange rind, strawberry, all soaked in the lemony tang and mold of wilderness rain.  It isnt so much the confronting tartness of the cherries as it is the erudite nuances of brown spice on citrus that makes this seem so stunningly innovative.  Minerals and aged balsamic in the tangy, earthy mid palate; hints of dried tomato and salt beneath a merciless wash of acetic acid.  Palate is frothy and full, lively, cottony, punchy, dank, old; perfect.  Finishes with a furious barren dryness on the dregs of lime, vinegar and sour cherry; tangy, ebullient sourness, distant darting spices and sawdusty, moldy funk coat the mouth.  Full of surprises and of foreign, unexpected complexities; a rewarding start to finish experience.

Pours a cloudy raspberry-brown with a thin wispy, whitish head. The nose is a big, funky, sour cherry, with an emphasis on the funk. Medium-bodied and super-tart it finishes dry and sour. The flavor is precisely like the nose, with super-funky sour cherries dominating, and a dry, sour finish leaving a smile on the face. This is a nice kriek and a world apart from the sweet krieks produced by Lindemans and St. Louis. Thanks for cracking this one open, Tim!

750 ml bottle, purchased at Lukas, KCMO, enjoyed at my Holiday Mini Tasting.  Pour is reddish brown, with a 1/2 inch tan head that fades immediately.  Aroma of pure funk, nice woody sourness.  Taste of the sourness, and big cherry / raspberry fruitiness.  The wood is present as well, though it is nicely blended with the fruit.  Finish is very dry.  Really nice beer, much more sour than expected though I loved that.
Tart cherries, funk, leather, horse blanket, light vinegar, and wood. Taste is nicely tart with sour cherries, wet wool blanket, red wine vinegar, oak and vanilla.

Pretty reddish color, tart cherry but skunky aroma. Flavor is tart, cherries at beginning, but musty, harsh finish. I really disliked this beer, but am wondering if I had a bad bottle from our local wine shop... May give it another try, but really steep price may deter that.

750, corked, baled, foiled. 3/1/05 btl. Pours bright red--truly a gem-like ruby hue, for all the times we mention ruby highlights in the body, this one actually has that color. Fairly tall and very fizzy pink head that falls to light lacing and a slim rim of pink. Sharp vinous cherry nose with mild funk interwoven. Puckery sharp acidulence right from the attack. Cherry tartness takes over and in the end leaves with a somewhat mineraly pucker on the finish.

March 1st, 2005 bottle. Excellent kriek aroma with a horseblanket and wet hay mixed with sweet tart cherries and tannic cherry pits. Surprisingly light carbonation, giving this an almost watery mouthfeel. That much is unfortunate. I did have a moderately difficult time rousing a head on the pour, but did get one, which faded quickly into a very thin ring of foam, pinkish in color, atop the hazy purple of the beer itself. Theres a nice hard acidity to this without being over the top, and its not really all that sweet. The cherries are just there, complementing the flavors but not really on equal footing. Very dry, slightly tannic finish, perhaps shows a little bit of oak here. A little brett funk is apparent in the middle between the initial sourness and the woody finish, but you really have to concentrate for that one. Overall really good, just not as *great* as Id hoped it would be.

thanks nhorween. looks like pink hoobastank.  smells like a cherry kriek. tastes pretty damn balanced for the style. i was telling these guys earlier that its not as vinegary as some other krieks ive had. i like it for its balance. i could drink plenty of this without getting jaded.

Corked and caged bottle from boboski - thanks!  Bottled 01 March 2005, consumed 09 December 2007.  Deep Burgundy pour really lets off a lot of air - not exactly aggressively carbonated, but still very active.  Very fine, teeny tiny bubbles compose the dense layer of pink, lacing head.  Rush of sour cherry (with a touch of sweetness) and wild fermentation.  Taste is strong sour with an even stronger woody dryness, but theres no sense of aggression or histrionics.  Sour cherries prominent here but the general sense is more of fruit than cherry.  Puckering acidity, but again, not overdone.  Its interesting to find something with such a robust, complex taste and such a blunted after; the sour and tart notes fade almost immediately, and what little sweetness there was in the main course is nowhere to be found in the finish.  Medium-full body on the heftier side of style, with a short dry, wooden aftertaste.  Smooth and superbly balanced ... exudes class.  About as solid as they come.

Small serving during 11-30-07 tasting at the Lex-Larp Cellars as I joined joet and the Twin Cities crew. Poured from a 750 mL bottle. Sharp, tangy, yeasty aroma features fruit sweetness. Pours a cool looking, hazy red with a light pink head. Awesome, sharp, sour taste. Very dry and wine-like. Reminds me of a great pink champagne. Raspberry flavor; if I didnt know this was a kriek, Id have sworn it was a framboise. Thats okay because I prefer raspberries to cherries anyway. Tangy aftertaste. Light to medium body. Soft in the palate. This is a well-made, interesting, and delicious brew. I wish I had more to say about it, but this is the 12th of 13 beers I had that night in the tasting, and as anyone who has taken notes on a bunch of beers in one day knows, they tend to get sloppy and cursory toward the end, not to mention the burnt-out palate phenomenon.

[Bottle] Pours red with a light pink head. Aroma is about what I expected, sour, funky, some cherry. Taste is the same. Medium mouthfeel, long finish. This is one of the weakest styles for me to rate as I definitely enjoy most of the beers...but have difficulty picking out many flavors aside from varying degrees of funkiness, sourness, and whatever fruit happens to be in it. Definitely one to come back and re-rate some time.

Fruity, smooth and mildly bitter kriek. Delicious. 75 cL from the 2007 batch, sipped from champagne flutes. Way better than any champagne Ive had. Pours blood read with a bubbly, pink head. Nose is full of wild and black cherries. Sour flavor is restrained by a surprising layer of hoppy and acidic bitterness, makes a tasty, harmonious balance. Fruit is less than intense in the flavor. Dry finish. Fantastic.

[Bottle at Ølbaren] Pours hazy deep red with small short lasting pink head. Sour aroma with fresh authentic cherry and oak notes. Sour flavor with lovely cherry notes that finishes of with nice citric acid character. Great complexity. Great beer!
Sweet raspberry aroma. Pours a cloudy red with thin head. Sweet fruit aroma and tart finish. Acids and carbonation make for a lively palate.

Shared at miketds tasting
This was my final sample of the night before taking off for home.  I was glad to give it a try.  It reinforces my desire to hunt down a bottle for myself despite the price tag.  Perhaps once I clear some room in the cellar Ill go ahead and pull the trigger next time I am in Ann Arbor.  Those of you in Europe who can get this cheaply should consider yourself lucky.
Aroma / Appearance - The body was a rich cherry red (almost like Belgian Red but with more head).  Tart cherries created an intensely sour nose.  Unlike some Cantillon products though it was not strong enough to turn my stomach.
Flavor / Palate - Very sour acidic cherries was the primary star of this sample.  It did not immediately attack the lining of my stomach like Lou Pepe Kriek but it was very close.  This is definitely one for sipping unless you have a cast iron stomach.  I will definitely have to try to get this again for a special occasion.

750. light dankness and musty with sour cherries. light red/pink pour with a pink bubbly head that quickly fades. great carbonation. mildly tart cherry with some vinegar. wonderfully balanced and mild. dry finsih with enoug acidity to keep it crisp and cleansing. awesome.
750ml bottle; nose of light funk, horseblanket, and cherries; red with a small pinkish head; Falvor is mildly tart with cherries, and some acidity for a finish.

Bottle. 2006 vintage. Pleasant tartness initially on the nose. Some sour cherry. A hint of musty barnyard funk, but not too overpowering. Restrained and balanced. Pours rich, ruby pink. Mildly tart and sour on the tongue. Some acidic tart cherry notes, but far from sweet. Medium bodied. Vibrant carbonation. Finishes with a burst of pleasant acidity.

bottled, thanks duff. deep red with no head, some fizz.full-on aroma - tart apple peel, pre-ripe cherries, faint cherry ripe sweetness then some cider vinegar and finishes quite dry. delicious stuff, one of the best fruit lambics out there

Bottle courtesy of Mes_and_Sim. Blood red with a lasting thin pink head. Cherry sherbert nose with some yeast and a bit of hay. Sour puckering cherry but also some subtle sweetness, red wine vinegar and barnyard funk in the taste. Feels good in the mouth with a long dry finish. Gets better by the sip, can see several re-rates in the future.

(750ml bottle) Sampled at the Post-Great Canadian Beer Festival 2007 in Victoria on September 8th, 2007. Courtesy of Presario. Large pinkish head with a deep red body. Tart aroma and flavour yet a disappointing short palate.

2006 Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy deep red with a small but lasting pink head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of earthy brett spice, light sour cherries, oak, and light citrus. Taste is sour cherries, earthy brett goodness, light oak, and light citrus. Medium thin mouthfeel with a medium amount of bitterness and mildly spicy dry finish. A wonderfull Lambic.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2009 Bottle 2005 vintage.  An opaque, still ruby when poured, the Shaerbeekse Kriek is funky barnyard, but also redolent of sour cherries that are developing towards ripeness.  
The taste is unripe cherry with its dull sourness that sticks to the back of the tongue, almost a saltiness.  I do not see this as overly complex; I mean, I am trying to look for other flavors, but I really cant detect anything but the subtle cherry and unripe profile therein contained.  Someone said coconut, and actually, I am starting to see that- a slight milkiness in the aftertaste that is very coconut-like.  Other than that, not very complex, but solid. Oh yeah, I cant forget the brett!  Yummy.
this beer has an intense funk aroma.   pours moderately still, ruby red color.  flavor is your expected brett, tart and maybe some saltiness on the back end.  i am starting appreciate this style.

2007 Summer Secret Santa. Bottle shared at CapFlus tasting after GCBF. Dark red. Thin head. Vinegar and raspberry aroma. Sour bitter cherry flavour. I love these beers, although my tasting skill may not have been at their sharpest. Still a real treat.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2009 750ml Bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Lambic days 2007)
Very dark, turbid pink. Coconut, and dry cider sourness on the nose. Then some bitterness and cherry, and finally more coconut. Hugely crisp sour cherry taste, plenty of dry coconut taste and a cherry finish. Excellent kriek.

The body is a hazy purple topped by a spritzy pink head. Underneath the typical lambic funk, theres a spicy almost pepper aroma that actually complements the subdued cherries nicely. The sourness lingers in the finish with a slight astringency. Not very sweet, but interesting.

Date: 04/06/2006
Mode: Bottle
Source: Ale Atlanta

blood red, scant head, light sweet tart cherry aroma, creamy body, big cherry flavor, well balanced sweet and tart character, long tart finish
-------- />
Date: 09/16/2006
Mode: bottle

muddy dark blood red, whispy pink head, rich deep cherry flavor, nice tartness

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.4/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **+/4

dirtymike shared this as a breakfast beer during BBD 07.  Poured a nice deep red with a pink head.  Aroma was alot of sour cherry, funk, and oak.   Taste was moderately sour- with sour cherries, vinegar, and a decent amount of woody oak and horseblanket/funk.  Slightly sweet with some wheat in the background.  Finishes tart,  dries the palate and leaves you wanting more.

Many thanks to Blake for this treat!  Deep Ruby color with some cloudiness from the sediment remaining in bottle.  Aromas of horsehair and wet burlap.......but in a good way.  Sour wild cherry aroma also tossed in for good measure with that being vey much the taste sensation throughout.  However, good use of brett, malt and hop character to prevent the cherries from taking over.  Well balanced overall, but I wouldve liked to have seen more of the funk in this one.

750ml, March 2005 bottle.  Poured a deep red color, darker than I expected, with a fine head.  Tart and funky aroma - slight woody notes, and the cherries werent overpowering at all, which was excellent.  Really solid aroma in my opinion.  Flavor is tart and slightly sweet, with light cherry undertones.  Big finish thats mostly sour.  Nice on the palate.  A great lambic, a really great example of the style, in my limited exposure to them.

Pours a slighty cloudy ruby color with a tiny pinkish head into the flute glass.  The scent was of sour cherries, oak, vinegar and some yeast.  The flavor is very sour with cherries and vinegar rushing to the front of the palate.  I still cant get into the sourness of lambic beers.  Too tart for my liking.

I cracked open a Feb 06 bottle of this with my brother recently on a nice recommendation by my buddy MoeJuck!  thanks for pointing me in the right direction joe!!  Now onto the beer...poured a nice pinkish red with an off white reddish tinted head.  Very very funk filled aroma with lots of barnyard horseblanket and all that going on mixed in with a nice meld of sourness, vanilla, and oak.  The flavor is lots of the woodyness and vanilla mixed together with quite a bit of underipened tart black cherries.  The sourness is not over the top at all and is very enjoyable throughout this beer.  Finishes very dry and refreshing and leaves you wanting more and more with each sip...another good lambic that is making me believe more and more into the complexity that is the lambic style.
Bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Strange white shade in the body, pink head. Cinnamon and coconut on the nose. Extreme taste! Coconut, kriek and... aaaah...

Lot Number 22 March 2006
7/11/2007:  3 Fonteinen Schaerbeekse Kriek has an aroma of real bing cherries with a slightly acidic and musty quality to it.  It is dark ruby red in color (purple hue to it as well) with a pink/nearly red foamy head.  The flavor is also musty and acidic as well as sour.  There is a long, tart cherry and wheat finish.  The body of this beer is medium-light to medium and is nicely carbonated.  Complex and very good!
750 ml bottle (Alc 6% Vol.) shared by Tmoney99 at the Dilly Deli.  Thanks Tom.  I appreciate it!  Rating #231 for this beer...

750ml bottle. Thanks to gputty for bringing this to my last minute tasting - I wasnt even sure he drank beer anymore. Brown-tinged red with a slightly pinkish head. Lightly astringent cherry nose, some light funkiness. Mildly sour cherry flavor, lightly acidic finish. Excellent!
